            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   the Related Job field of the new and this job, the job
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   number of the alternate job. [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	C  TSH 8 & 9 Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   of cabinets, tops of cabinet doors,  tops of meter
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   cleaning materials .  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris. [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	7. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait. replace bait
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	8. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   job sheet.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   corrective actions.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	10. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (a) All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (b) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (c) In TSH 09, ensure UPS is left in a state of readiness
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        for operation. [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	11.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     or his representative of any corrective actions.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     Include in the Related Job field of the new and this job,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     the number of the alternate Job.[_ _]

000030014887	03 M Insp of A/C units at Substation 2. 	0000000000015891	03 M Insp of A/C units at Substation 2. 	A	AU01743 	01	03 M Inspect of Liebert A/C units at Substation 2.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	2. Access to the Air Conditioning units in the Substation 2
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   building is via external doors into the SS02 building in Swan
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Street. The condenser units are located on the roof of the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   building.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     vibration.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        setting.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        the following steps
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       (i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	           displayed)
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	      (ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     (iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	           setting.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	      (iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       (v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	      (vi) Wait until unit cuts out,  and verify that
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	           temperature shown on unit is consistent with new
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	           setpoint and verify temperature is consistent with
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	           ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	           thermometer.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        original setting.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        point is reached and verify that the temperature is
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        consistent with ambient using the portable
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        thermometer.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	  NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	  cycle.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary.   Filter type
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     Liebert size 650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     is clear.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.1.  Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	      operation.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     running.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local fan isolating
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	      switch.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.6. Clean the condenser coils, if required using compressed
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     air.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local fan isolator.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     Unit.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    thoroughfares:
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    walls.   [___]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    will collect dust deposits.   [___]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    enclosure.  [___]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    dust.   [___]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    Clear any blockages.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	7.0. On completion of job record anything outside normal
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    parameters
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	         leaks
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	         lighting faults
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	         door damage
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    evidence of structural damage to the Equipment room and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    equipment etc,  in the Work Done section of the job sheet
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    and report to the Team Leader or his representative and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    raise a new job for any repairs.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	1. The 12 month service of the air conditioner shall be carried
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   out by the sub-contractor in the presence of the electrical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   electronic technician and in conjunction with the 3 monthly
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   service.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	2. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	3. Access to the TSH 09 Air Conditioning units in the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Substation 2 building is via external doors into the SS02
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   building in Swan Street.  The condenser units are located on
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   the roof of the  building.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5. Check the electrical switchboard for
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (a) Faulty indicating lamps  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (b) Connections, contacts, wiring and or components that may
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       be overheating.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6. Compare the meter readings of the motor current with the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   nameplate ratings.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	7. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following electrical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   service:
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (a) Check switchboard for overload settings.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (b) Check all electrical control equipment operations and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       calibration.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (c) Check functionality and calibration of microprocessor
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       based controls.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	8. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   service at the compressor.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (a) Accurately assess and record compressor
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       superheat.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (b) Check and record the suction and discharge
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       pressures.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (c) Check that the suction and discharge pressures are normal
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       and stable.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (d) Confirm that the refrigerant charge is correct and that
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       there are no leaks.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (e) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       fit a new dryer if required.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (f) Check the crankcase heater for correct operation.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (g) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       fit new new dryer if required.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (h) Check that the compressor mounting rubbers are secure and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       serviceable.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	9. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   service at the evaporator.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (a) Check the efficiency of the evaporator.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (b) Check the evaporator air flow.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (c) Check the evaporator fan operation for efficiency and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       rectify any degraded operation.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (d) Check the evaporator for leaks, repair any faults
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       found.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (e) Check the filter media for efficiency and operation, fit
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       a new filter if required.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	10. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    service at the condenser.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (a) Check the condenser air flow.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (b) Check the cooling fan(s) operation for efficiency and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        rectifying any degraded operation.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (c) Check the condenser for leaks, repair any faults
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        found.    [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	11. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    service at the humidifier (where fitted).
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (a) Check the humidifer inlet water strainer for
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        blockage.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (b) Check the humifier operation.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	12. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	14. If sub contractor costs are unknown use the amount entered
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    in the Estimated Job Costs as an additional cost in the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    transactions.  Use Sub-contractor Costs - Outside Services.

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   sheet and raise a new job sheet for any  repairs carried out

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	7. Inspect all enclosures for evidence of rodent or insect
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   infestation.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	8. Visually check cable terminations for tightness,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   distortion.  [_ _]

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   arcing etc.  [_ _]

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    serviceability.   [_ _]

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	1. Notify the control room prior to entering each Technical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Shelter.

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Manual - Uninterruptible Power Supplies"  On-Line Series
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   UME V. 5.2 4kVA, 6kVA, 8kVA, 10kVA.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	3. Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   charged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   [ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 13.5
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    indicate a battery fault. ]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4. (a) Press the "Control" button on the UPS, followed by the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Down Arrow"" button until the message  CONTROL BYPASS MODE
   appears.
   (b) Press the "Control" button and "Enter" button
       simultaneously, the UPS will transfer into the bypass
       mode.
,,   **If at anytime during load transfer the UPS ,,,,,,
          malfunctions, notify TCR prior to continuing.**
    c) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.  The
       "Bypass O/P" indicator should be illuminated.   [_ _]
    (d) Contact the Traffic Control Room to confirm receipt of
        alarm condition.   [_ _]
    (e) Scroll through menu using the "Display" button followed
        by the "Down Arrow"
    (f) Remove side covers from the UPS.   WARNING THE UPS IS
        STILL ALIVE.
    (g) Visually inspect the interior of the UPS for accumulated
        dust, connections or other components that may show
        obvious distress.   [_ _]
    (h) Check that both the front and rear fans are operating
       (The front fan is thermostatically controlled).    [_ _]
    (i) Press the "Control" button, then press the "Down Arrow"
        until the message "CONTROL INVERTOR MODE" appears. [_ _]
     (j) Press the "Control" button and the "Enter" button
         simultaneously, wait approx 10 seconds  until the UPS
         reverts back to its normal operation.   [_ _]
5. (a) Contact TCR prior to isolating.
,,   Switch to the OFF position the wall mounted isolator or
       CB1, on the rear  of the UPS to transfer the load to the
       batteries. Check with TCR once load has been transferred
        to batteries that a power failure has not occurred.
,,   **Do not turn isolator back on for 20 seconds as this may
        cause damage to the equipment.**
   NOTE: Ensure that the Circuit breaker (C/B2) on the rear of
         the UPS is not accidentally turned off at  this stage
         as CB2 isolates the batteries.
   (b) Continue with the UPS supplying the load from the
       batteries for at least 10 minutes.
   (c) Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being
       discharged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
       Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
      [ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 13.5
        and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will
        indicate a battery fault. ]
   (d) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.  The
     "On Battery " indicator should be illuminated.    [_ _]
   (e) Scroll through menu using the "Display" button followed
       by the "Down Arrow".  Record the voltage and current
       details on form UPS Battery Test Sheet
       TMF-3012-OP-0037   [_ _].
   (f) Switch to the ON position the wall mounted isolator or
       CB1, on the rear  of the UPS to transfer the load to the
       normal supply.
6. Battery Panel.
   (a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
       Batteries.
   (b) Ensure the Circuit Breaker operating handle, on side
       panel door, is in the upright position and is not
       tripped.  [_ _]
   (c) Measure and record the overall charge voltage across the
       CB ( nominally 217V. )    [_ _]
7. Record any result outside normal parameters, in the " Work
   Done " area of the job sheet.
8. Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
9. Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.

         back to the "AUTOMATIC CONTROL" position.  The

   (c) Check the cable connections for tightness and signs of
       overheating, inspect the electrical control
       equipment.  [_ _]
   (d) Record in the Work Done area of job sheet, the hour-run
       meter readings for each pump, these are to be obtained
       from the PMCS.  To obtain the correct results:
      (i) On  the CCCS System, click on the Entities button
     (ii) In the entry field of the Entities Faceplate type SW
    (iii) Then look for SWDW1RUN in the list.
     (iv) Double click on the SWDW1RUN, then record the hours
          run shown in the HOURS field.
      (v) Repeat steps (d) (iii) to (d) (iv) for each of
          SWDW2RUN, SWDW3RUN, SWGW1RUN, SWGW2RUN in
          order. [_ _]
5. Repeat step 4 for Control Panel B.  [_ _]
6. Inspect the pump wet wells and the valve pit.
   (a) Inspect the wet wells through the access ladder hatch for
       general cleanliness and any accumulated debris, inspect
       for any evidence of leakage.   [_ _]
   (b) Inspect the external conditions of the pipework and the
       valves for corrosion (Rust).  Minor corrosion (rust) is
       to be removed with a wire brush and the cleaned surface
       painted with Coldgal.   [_ _]
   (c) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet evidence of
       leaks and any corrective works that are outstanding.
       Raise a new jobsheet for any corrective works
       outstanding.   [_ _]
   (d) Lubricate Isolating Valves with Loctite Silver Grade Anti ,,
  Seize Lubricant or Equivalent.  [_ _]
   (e) Operate all pump manual isolating valves through AT LEAST
       THREE (3) OPEN/CLOSED cycles to confirm valve
       operationally.  Ensure the valves are left in the fully
       open position on completion.  [_ _]
7. Test the operation of Hydrocarbon detector, by releasing a
   small amount of gas from a small LPG bottle.     [_ _]
8. Work plan for the PSSWDP1, Dirty Water Pump 1
   (a) Check the inlet tundish for any blockage or accumulated
       debris, clean out if required.  [_ _]
   (b) Check the triple interceptor trap for any evidence of oil
       on the surface, turbidity and the correct operation of
       the discharge valve.   [_ _]
   (c) Check the operation of float switches.  To test lift the
       High/High float and Low/Low floats respectively, then
       check that the alarms are received at the Control
       Room.  [_ _]
   (d) Observe the level controller readout for variations, with
       respect to the pump operations.   [_ _]
   (e) Check the cabling to the pump for damage and that it is
       clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
   (f) When this job falls in either December, March, June or
       September.  Lift the level controller sensor out of the
       protective conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in
       the sensor base of all dirt or debris.   [_ _]
9. Switch the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector to the MANUAL
   position.   [_ _]
10. (a) Check and note the position of the pump non-return valve
       (NRV) counterweight prior to starting the pump.  [_ _]
    (b) Start the pump PSSWDWP1 by pressing the START push
        button.
  CAUTION: Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
  alarm point as the lack of submergence may cause damage to the
  pumpset.
   (c) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work Done
       area of the job sheet if the current reading is greater
       than FLC 190A.  [_ _]
    (d) Observe pump operation for smooth running, vibration and
        abnormal noises. [_ _]
    (e) Observe that the pump discharge rate is sufficient to
        draw down the water level in the sump.   [_ _]
    (f) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton. Check
        the operation of the non-return valve (NRV), as the
        water flow  stops.
       (i) The NRV should close with a sharp audible metallic
           sound
      (ii) The counterweight returning to it's pre-start
           position or lower, as well
     (iii) backflow through pump should cease within 30 seconds.
      (iv) If a faulty closure is suspected, the pump should be
           re-started, operated for 2 minutes and the operation
           of the NRV monitored again.    [_ _]
11. Repeat steps 8 through to 10 for pump PSSWDWP2.   [_ _]
12. Repeat steps 8 through to 10 for pump PSSWDWP3.   [_ _]
13. Return the  AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
    position.       [_ _]
14. Switch the ground water pump AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch
    to the MANUAL position
   (a) Check the operation of the float switches.  To test, lift
       the High/High float and Low/Low float respectively, then
       check that the alarms are received at the control
       room. [_ _]
   (b) Observe the level controller readout for variations, with
       respect to the operation of the pump  [_ _]
15. Start the pump PSSWGWP1 by pressing the START push button.
  CAUTION: Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
  alarm point as the lack of submergence may cause damage to the
  pumpset.
   (a) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work
       Done area of the job sheet (FLC 50A).  [_ _]
   (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running or
       vibration and abnormal noises. [_ _]
   (c) Check that the pump discharge rate is sufficient to draw
       down the water level in the sump.     [_ _]
   (d) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.  Check
       the operation of the NRV.  Full valve closure will be
       indicated by the backflow through pump ceasing within
       30 seconds.  Excessive backflow (longer than 30 seconds)
       occurring, may indicate that debris is jammed in the
       valve preventing a full closure.  The pump should be
       re-started, operated for a further 2 minutes and the
       operation of the NRV monitored again.  [_ _]
       If a faulty closure is still suspected, report the fault
       for corrective maintenance.
   (e) Re-grease Motor bearings and Pump main bearing using
       general multi purpose grease.
   (f) Clean bottom of pump housing where drain water is
       collected.
16. Repeat steps 14 and 15 for pump PSSWGWP2.
17. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
    position.  [_ _]
18. When this job falls in either December, March, June or
    September.  Lift the level controller sensor out of the
    protective conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the
    sensor base of all dirt or debris.   [_ _]
19. Check that the wet well ventilation system fan is
    operational and moving air from the wet well.  [_ _]
20. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area
    of the job sheet.  [_ _]
21. A Confined Space Entry permit is required prior to entering
    the sump
22. At the pump motor control panel, switch the pumps from
    Automatic Mode to Manual Mode and switch the two clean
    water pumps to the OFF position.
  DO NOT OPERATE THE PUMPS WITHOUT WATER COVERAGE.  THE PUMPS
  NEED TO BE SUBMERGED TO OBTAIN ADEQUATE COOLING OTHERWISE
  DAMAGE WILL OCCUR.
23. At the pump sump
   (a) Inspect the triple interceptor for debris, silt
       deposits and foreign objects, remove and clean if
       required.
   (b) Inspect the pump sump for debris, silt deposits and
       foreign objects, remove and clean if required.
24. Ensure the Triple Interceptor bypass valve is OPEN.
25. (a) Close Valve GW1 & GW2.   Record the result of all tests
        on form TMF-3012-OP-0273 - Burnley Tunnel Pump
        Calibration
    (b) Open valve GW1.
    (c) Start Pump GW1 using the On/Off Push Buttons
26. (a) Record head pressure
    (b) Record the flow rate (Large digits of Magmeter)
27. Close valve GW1 and Open valve GW2.  Repeat step 28 for
    pump GW2.
28. Open valve GW1.  Repeat  step 29 for pumps GW1 & GW2.
29. Once the test is complete, ensure that the valves (GW1 &
    GW2) are fully open.
30. Close the pressure gauge isolating valve and remove the
    pressure gauge.
31. At the pump motor control panel, switch the pumps from
    Manual mode to Automatic Mode.
32. Record the hours run for the pumps in the Work Done area of
    the jobsheet .
    The hour readings are obtained from the CCCs.
    The entities are SWDW1RUN, SWDW2RUN, SWDW3RUN, SWGW1RUN &
    SWGW2RUN
33. On completion of job record anything outside normal
    parameters
    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
         leaks
         lighting faults
         door damage
    evidence of structural damage to the pump station and
    equipment etc,  in the Work Done section of the job sheet
    and report to the Team Leader or his representative and
    raise a new job for any repairs.
34. Record in the Work Done area of the Job sheet any
    outstanding works that require further work.  Raise a new
    job sheet for any outstanding work that is required.
35. Notify the traffic control room on completion of the job.
36. Ensure the completed from TMF-3012-OP-0273 - Burnley Tunnel
    Groundwater Pump Calibration  is returned to the Electrical
    / Electronic Team leader or his representative for recording
    of the data.  Enter data into file at
    G:\TFM\Operations\Tunnel drainage\Burnley Tunnel Drainage\
      Swan St pump Flows.xls
     \ Data Entry. Print Graph and forward to Maintenance
     Operations Manager for information and forwarding to
     relevant authorities.

****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****

ASSET CONDITION RATING

Rate the Condition of the Assets.

Note:

[ 1 ] - Excellent.
        Asset is new or in as new condition

[ 2 ] - Good.
        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing
        it's intended function.

[ 3 ] - Fair.
        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
        deterioration that will result is some intervention
        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
        performing it's intended function to the full degree.

[ 4 ] - Poor.
        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
        intended function.

1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Access to ERW02 is via the stairwell in Alexandra Avenue.

  NOTE: Parking restrictions may apply between 7.00am and
   5.30pm.
   The airconditioning unit is located in equipment room ERW02
   and the condenser unit is located in the riser, adjacent to

   condenser unit is restricted.

   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City

4. Work plan for ACU-ERW2-1  - Air Conditioning Unit
4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
     vibration.   [_ _]
4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
     a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
        LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
        measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
        temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
        setting.   [_ _]
     b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
        the following steps
        (i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
            displayed)
       (ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
      (iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
            setting.
       (iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
        (v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
       (vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that
            temperature shown on unit  is consistent with new
            setpoint and verify temperature is consistent with
            ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
            thermometer.   [_ _]
     c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
        original setting.   [_ _]
     d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
        point is reached and verify that the temperature is
        consistent with ambient using the portable
        thermometer.   [_ _]
    NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
    cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
     and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary   Filter type
     Liebert size 650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
     is clear.   [_ _]
4.6. Restart unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
5. The work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
     operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
     running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local isolating
     switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local isolator.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
     Unit.   [_ _]
6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
     thoroughfares:
6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the

6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
    will collect dust deposits.   [___]
6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
    enclosure.  [___]
6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
    dust.   [___]
6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.

6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and
    rubbish.   [_ _]

A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of Equipment
Room ERW00 as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the
relevant area.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( ERW00 )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Equipment room.
2. On entering Equipment room, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans,
if operating (fans not
    required to be  switched OFF in technical shelters and appropriate
equipment
    rooms).   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
   and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Check the interior lighting for operation, including the operational
tube within EXIT signs,
    replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
equipment and
   components within all switchboards and distribution panels mounted
with the equipment
   room.
   Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus
10C should be
   considered abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of
the Job Sheet and
   ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. Raise a new
   job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and
   components  for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.  Record anything
   abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and raise a new
jobsheet for any
   corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is
informed of the
   abnormality.  [_ _]
7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering,
    arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and escutcheons
   for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required.
 Carry out any required repairs
   or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
     clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace  filters as
     required.  [_ _]
12. Inspect systems, mounted within the room(s), for faulty indicators,
faulty meters,
     damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator
lamp replacement or
     raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.   [_ _]
13.  PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
   (a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
toindicate abnormal
        conditions are to be logged in the work done area of the job
sheet and a new job sheet
         raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
   (b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
         connections, for security.  [_ _]
   (c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are not
         loose.  [_ _]
   (d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the enclosure
andPLC modules
         are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
14. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
      accumulation.
15.   Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the Job
       Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective actions.  [_ _]
C. Equipment room Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
Inspect for source of
   any water.  Record any details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job
sheet and inform the Team
   Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
stored items.  Remove
   any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,
cable trays,
    cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces,
e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops
    of cabinet doors, tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]
4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved cleaning
materials .  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light fittings,cable
trays and
   ceilings.  [_ _]
6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.   [_ _]
7. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
8. In the Exhaust Fan (6, 7 & 8) area check the lighting for operation.
 Remove all debris

for any outstanding

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job as well as prior
to entering the stairwell.
2. (a) Refer to Maintenance Manual, ""Operating and Maintenance manual
for Mechanical
         Services - MCL Tunnels"" M-STG-ME-27400.
   (b) Refer to AS 1668.1 - Appendix A for detail and methodology of
stair pressurisation
         commissioning tests.
3. Check the exhaust grill in the wall of the stairwell to ensure it is
free of debris that would
    restrict the flow of air.   [_ _]
4. Ensure that the door between the Domain Tunnel and the stairwell is
closed.
5. Check that the door in the link walkway, isolating the stairwell
fromthe sub-station is closed.
6. Check that both the inlet and exhaust silencers are free from debris
(Use a torch from the
    inlet)
7. Request the traffic control operator to start the fan SA-YPS-01
(ESF-P06) from the TCR.
   Ensure the fan starts. Check that the airflow direction is into the
stairwell. [_ _]
8.   NOTE:  The alarm to be raised will not call the fire brigade.  It
will register on the local FIP
     and CCCS as a local alarm.
     Remove the access cover over the smoke detector, direct ""test
smoke"" from a smoke
     generator, as specified on the container, onto the smoke detector
(on the inlet duct).  Check
     that an alarm actuates on the local fire indicator panel.   The
smoke detector must be in
     fault for approx 2 mins for the fan to stop and for an alarm to
generate on the CCCS. [_ _]
9. Check and inspect the Stairwell area.
   (a) Check the inlet grill to the substation, to ensure that it is
notdamaged and is free of debris
         that would restrict the free flow of air.   [___]
   (b) Ensure that the door between the Domain Tunnel and the stairwell
area is closed.
   (c) Check each door for damage, as well check the rollers, runners,
hinges, handles,
         catches, and counter-weights for efficient operation.  [_ _]
   (d) With the supply air fan SA-YPS-01 ( ESF-P06) operating, record
the differential air
        pressure within the stairwell and at substation level.  Record
readings less than 50Pa in
        the ""Work Done' area of the Job sheet. Notify the
superintendent for further
       investigation.  [_ _]
   (e) At each of the doors, starting from the tunnel and working
towards the fan.
          Arrange the door catch to be non-functioning, then using a
spring balance, measure the
          force required to open the door.  Record the results in the
Work Done"" area of the Job
          sheet if a force greater than 11kg is required, as well advise
the maintenance
          superintendent for further investigation.   [_ _]
    (f ) Check the time taken for the air pressure to return to the
static reading.  Record in the
          ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet if time is greater than 2
minutes. Notify the
          superintendent for further investigation.
    (g) Chock each door open, then using an anemometer, measure the
velocity of air out of the
          open door.  The reading is to be with the door fully open and
with no obstructions.
          Record the results in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job sheet
if the air flow is less
          than 1 meter /sec as well advise the maintenance
superintendent for further
          investigation.  [_ _]
    (h) Check the fan and motor for undue noise and vibrations.   [_ _]
    (i ) Check the fan bearings for noise.   [_ _]
    (j ) Check the fan unit for damage, corrosion, missing panel
fixings, as well as checking
          the fixings of the unit for security.  [_ _]
10. Ensure the action of opening a stairwell door;
     (a) Generates an alarm at the TCR workstation.
     (b) Causes the fan speed to vary to maintain a positive pressure
inthe stairwell.
     (c) To replicate the action of the smoke detector, remove the
YARRACROSSING EGRESS
           STAIR FAN RELAY (mounted in the rear compartment of the
localFIP) for at least two and
           a half minutes to ensure the fan stops.  Replace the relay
once the action is
           confirmed  [_ _] (A local alarm will register on the CCCS.
 The fire brigade
           will not be called)
11. Run the fan for a further 5 minutes, with the door in both the open
and the closed position
      then advise the traffic control room to shut the fan down and to
turn OFF the lighting after
      leaving the stairwell, ensuring that the door to the tunnel is
closed.
12. Ensure the stairwell is clean and all rubbish and debris is removed
from the stairwell.  [_ _]
13. Record anything outside normal parameters in the ""Work Done"" area
of the Job Sheet.
14. Ensure the door between the stairwell and the Domain Tunnel is
closed.
15. Notify the Control Room on completion of the job.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

WARNINGS:
1. DO NOT CARRY OUT THESE CHECKS  WHENEVER MORE THAN 2 FANS ARE
   OPERATIONAL
2. DO NOT ENTER THE AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM ALONE.
   TWO OR MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT WHENEVER ANY  WORK  IS
   CARRIED OUT IN THIS AREA.
3. OBSERVE ALL NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS
4. DO NOT ENTER A SMOKE DUCT UNLESS A PERMIT HAS BEEN OBTAINED
   FOR WORK IN THIS AREA.   TO CROSS THE DUCT A SERVICE LADDER
   MUST BE USED AT ALL TIMES
1. Obtain the Permit to Work for entry to the ventilation rooms
   and to interrupt operations.
2. Inform control room prior to commencing work. Maintain radio
   contact at all times.
3. Reference manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance
   Instructions Manual(M-STG-VE-26059)
4. Access to the Grant St ventilation station, on the mezzanine
   level, is via double locked doors on the stairway in Grant
   St. adjacent to vent stack.  Access to substation 1 is
   through the mezzanine level walkway north of the smoke duct,
   then crossing over the smoke duct twice a using service
   ladders to the roof of the substation, then down a service
   ladder to the tunnel and then along the tunnel walkway to the
   substation.
5. (a) On MCC in Substation No 1, switch one axial fan into
       operation, while maintenance is being carried out  on the
,,   other fans.  Switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch to
,,   the MANUAL position the REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch
,,   to the REMOTE position then start the fan by pressing the
,,   START pushbutton.   [_ _]
   (b) Isolate ALL non-operational axial fans by switching the
,,   AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switches to the OFF position and
,,   then carrying out electrical isolation procedures as set
,,   out in Work Instruction TMI -3012 OP - 0103,  Low Voltage
,,   Isolation Procedures.
6. Electrical checks in Substation No 1
   (a) Measure and record the insulation resistance on stator
,,   windings in ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
   (b) Check ammeter and record the reading for each phase in
,,   the work done area of the Job Sheet.
   (b) Inspect the control panel both internally and externally
,,   for damage, corrosion, evidence of moisture ingress,
,,   accumulated dust and grime (clean as required).   [_ _]
7. Fan Room Access
   (a) Enter the airlock first from the mezzanine level.   The
,,   airlock doors require considerable force to open due to
,,   pressure differentials.  Equalize the corridor and fan
,,   room pressures using the hatches in the wall before
,,   entering the fan room.
,,   NOTE: HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN IN THE
,,   VENTILATION FAN ROOM
   (b) Check the CO levels in the fan room through the doorway
,,   before entering and at regular intervals while performing
,,   the fan checks.
   (c) WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY OR MATERIALS
,,   WITHIN 1 METRE OF AN OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD.
,,   Airflow velocity is near 35 km/h.
8. Static Fan Checks for each fan.
   (a) Confirm that the fan on which maintenance is to be
,,   carried out on, is electrically isolated using the local
,,   push button station, by depressing the emergency STOP
,,   pushbutton.
   (b) Remove the entry cowl safety grill hatch and enter the
,,   fan inlet cowl.
   (c) Check the impeller for dirt, wear on blade tips or blade
,,   leading edges, as well as for any mechanical damage. [_ _]
   (d) Check all cables for security of fixings, damage
,,  especially at the site of any functional penetrations.[_ _]
   (e) Remove the inspection hatch on the side of the motor
,,   housing - Check for any grease discharged from the motor
,,   bearings, excessive amounts of grease as well as any
,,   noticeable colour change in the discharged grease.  Check
,,   that the grease nipples are clean.  [_ _]
   (f ) Examine both the motor connections and the motor
,,   internals for evidence of overheating.   [_ _]
   (g) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and
,,   heater windings.
,,,,(i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
,,,,(ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor
,,,,  Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans have been
,,,,  isolated and are to remain isolated.
,,,,,,(a) The motor is disconnected as above instruction.
,,,,,,(b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor
,,,,,,,,winding terminals.
,,,,(iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the
,,,,,,  motor windings and the winding heater bridge.  Record the result
in the ""Work Done"" area.
,,,,(iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
,,,,,, connections and carry out an Insulation resistance
,,,,,, test between this common bridge and earth.  Record
,,,,,, the result in the ""Work Done"" area.
,,,,(v) Remove all temporary connections.
        (vi) Remove supply lines to the motor and carry out an
,,,,,, insulation resistance test on the motor windings,
,,,,,, Between phase winding to phase winding and between
,,,,,, each phase winding and earth.  Record results in the
,,,,,, area of the Job sheet below
,,,,(vii) If the heater was connected on arrival, then
,,,,,, re-instate the heater connections,otherwise leave
,,,,,, the motor winding heater terminations isolated.
,,,,(viii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
,,,,(x)  Where any insulation resistance reading is less than
,,,,,, 2 megohm, then Record n the area of the Job Sheet
,,,,,, below and raise a new job for the outstanding works.
,,,,,, Include the Job Number of the new job in the
,,,,,, Customer Order No.field as well as in the alternate.
,,,,,, Notify the Team Leader or his representative of any
,,,,,, outstanding works.
   (h) Manually check the operation of the Rotork actuator and
,,   it's linkages, for the exit dampers, using the local
,,   control panel switch.   [_ _]
   (i) Always ensure the entry cowl safety grill to the fan is
,,   secured, in it's place, when the fan is unattended.
9. Running Fan Check and Lubrication
,,CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
,,REQUIRED AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
   (a) On completion of  the Static Fan Checks, return to
,,   substation 1, then remove the safety tags, in accordance
,,   with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then remove the fan motor isolation
,,   at  the MCC.
,,  Note:  Ensure that only one non-operational fan is isolated
,,  at any one time.
   (b) Switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF
,,   position to the MANUAL and the REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector
,,   switch from the REMOTE position to the LOCAL position.
   (c) Return to the ventilation room; there start the fan, that
,,   is being maintained, by releasing the local STOP
,,   pushbutton at the fan and then pressing START pushbutton.
   (d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan ,,
  starts.
   (e) Add Shell Stamina RL2 grease or equivalent, to the
,,   bearings, only while the fan is running.  DE = 100gr,
,,   NDE = 120gr.
   (f) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the
,,   bearings, using the retrieval system.  Examine the grease
,,   for changes of colour.   [_ _]
   (g) Check the fan for any abnormal noises or vibrations.[_ _]
   (h) Shutdown the fan motor using the local EMERGENCY STOP
,,   pushbutton.
  (i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
10. On completion, collect all tools and materials, to leave the
,,fan room, again equalize the corridor and fan room pressures.
11. (a)  In Substation No 1 remove all tags, in accordance with
,,,, TMI-3012-SA-0103, then remove the motor isolation for
,,,, all the fans at the MCC.   Return all the
,,,, MOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switches to the REMOTE position
,,,, and the AUTO/OFF/MAN fan selector switches to the AUTO
,,,, position.
,,(b)  Check that at least one fan is operational and that no
,,,, alarms are present
12. Record anything outside normal parameters in the area of the
,,,, Job Sheet below.
13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****

ASSET CONDITION RATING

Rate the Condition of the Asset.

Note:

[ 1 ] - Excellent.
        Asset is new or in as new condition

[ 2 ] - Good.
        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing
        it's intended function.

[ 3 ] - Fair.
        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
        deterioration that will result is some intervention
        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
        performing it's intended function to the full degree.

[ 4 ] - Poor.
        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
        intended function.

CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]

If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations
in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in emergency lane.
2. Access keys required for Sound Wall Gate, to access VMS 07.
   Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,
   TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059
   Plan 12 or 13 (Short term and low traffic volume).  Vic Roads
   approval required prior to doing job.
   Access to VMS 6 is from the car park below the elevated road.
3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment and
   or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
   equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to Safety
   Instructions  TMI-3012-SA-0101, Working  on Gantry
   Structures.
4. Arrange with the TCR for a Test Message to be displayed on
   the VMS.  Monitor operation and repair as required.  Monitor
   the LED Arrays and the Flashers for failed LEDS and
   record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet if the failed
   LEDs exceed 10% of the array.
   Arrange a new Job sheet for any outstanding works, recording
   the appropriate Job numbers in the Related Jobs  field
   and Notify the Team Leader or his representative
   of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
5. Carry out visual inspection externally and internally of the
   cabinets, sign, external cables and conduits for vandalism,
   mechanical damage, water ingress, condensation or insect
   infestation. Also check inside cabinets for tripped circuit
   breakers, disconnected wires, burn marks from excessive heat.
   [_ _]
6. Visually check for loose or missing nuts and bolts, and for
   rusted areas, rusted nuts or bolts. Cleans with wire brush
   and spray with Cold Gal or equivalent. This should be
   done with care and to avoid overspray. [_ _]
7. Inspect the external face of the lenses (for each pixel) for
   dirt and clean with Windex or equivalent  and clean rags
   if required.[_ _]
8. Note any corrective action required in the Work Done area
   of the Job Sheet and raise new Job Sheet if required.
9. Notify control room on departure.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

1. Dispose of existing water in Eye Wash unit, flush out and clean
container, clean eye wash
    unit by hosing and dry, refill container with fresh potable water.
2. Check for leaks, deterioration, and any damage.
4. Record in the Work Done area off the Job Sheet any outsanding works.
3. Notify the Civil Supervisor of any outstanding works requiring
further repairs.
