000030014463	03 M Insp, Test  & Clean CH S PS Equip  	0000000000015467	03 M Insp, Test  & Clean CH S PS Equip  	A	AU01653 	01	03 M Inspect, Test  & Clean Church St Pump Station Equipment
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to leaving
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	2. On accessing the pump station control panel(s), be aware of
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   the atmosphere, use your senses of sight, smell and hearing
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	3. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   the job sheet.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   corrective actions.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4. Reference Manual TOJV Pump Station Operation and Maintenance
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Manuals - M-STG-ME-20001. Volume 3.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5. WARNING:  BOTH THE WET WELL AND THE VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   CONFINED SPACES AND  MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   SPACE CONDITIONS.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   TMI-3012-SA-0015.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6. Inspect  the Switchboard
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (a) Check the switchboard, situated adjacent to the pump
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       station,  for local alarm conditions.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (b) Carry out visual inspections both internally and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       externally the control panel for vandalism, damage,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       corrosion, insect infestation, moisture ingress, dust and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       grime(clean as required).   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (c) Check the cable connections for tightness and evidence of
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       overheating and inspect the electrical control
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       equipment.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (d) Record the reading of the hour run meter, for the pump,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	7. Inspection of pump wet well and valve pit.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (a) Remove the gatic covers from both the wet well and the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       valve pit, inspect both the wet well and the valve pit
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       for general cleanliness and debris.  Clean if
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       required.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (b) Inspect the external condition of  the pipework and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       valves for evidence corrosion and leaks.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	8. Switch the pump AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the MANUAL
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   position.   [_ _] CAUTION:  Do not pump the wet well below
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   the Low/Low level alarm point as the lack of submergence may
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   cause damage to the pumpset.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (a) Check  the position of the counterweight for the pump
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       non-return valve (NRV) prior to starting the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       pump.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (b) Check that the cabling to the pump for damage and that it
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       is clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	9. Start the pump PSCH1 by pressing the START button.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (a) Measure and record the operating current of the pump in
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        the Work Donearea of the job sheet.  (FLC 75A.).
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        and abnormal noises.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (c) Observe the level controller readout for variations,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        with respect to the operation of the pump.   [_  _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (d) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.  Check
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        the operation of each non-return valve (NRV), as the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        water flow stops.  Indicators to the correct operation
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        of the NRV would be, the NRV closing with an sharp
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        audible metallic sound, the counterweight returning to
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        its original position or lower , as well, backflow
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        through the pump should cease within 30 seconds.  If a
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        faulty closure is suspected, the pump should be
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        re-started, operated for 2 minutes and  the operation of
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        the NRV should then be monitored again.  If a faulty
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        closure is still suspected, report for corrective
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        maintenance.    [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	10. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   position.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	11. Check the operation of the  float switches.  Manually trip
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    the floats from the surface by lifting up the High/High
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    float and  the Low/Low float cables respectively with a hook
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    bar and then checking if the alarms were received at the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    Control Room.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	12. When this job falls in either January, February or March.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    Lift the level controller sensor out of the protective
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the sensor base
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    of all dirt and debris.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	13. Test the operation of the isolating valves by partially
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    closing and then fully opening. [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	1. Check the interior and external lighting for operation,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   replace or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	2. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   and distribution panels.

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   plus 10C should be considered abnormal and must be noted in
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Leader or his representative is informed of the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   abnormality.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	3. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   equipment and components for evidence of burn marks, unusual
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   odours and overheating.  record anything abnormal
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and ensure the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   abnormality.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   actions.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	7. Inspect the electrical enclosures internally for dust, grime
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   and condensation, clean the enclosure(s) of any accumulated
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	8. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   obstructions.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	9. Visually inspect systems, mounted within the building or
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   room(s), for faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   switches and buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   actions.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	10. PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       found to indicate abnormal conditions are to be logged in
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       the work done area of the job sheet and a new job sheet
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       connections, screw connections, for security.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated dust
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       and debris.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	11. Clean lighting diffusers (including emergency and Exit
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    lighting) and lens of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	12. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.  Record
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    anything abnormal in the Work Done area of the job
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    sheet.  Record anything abnormal in the Work Done area
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    representative of outstanding actions.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	Building (Control Panel(s) Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	1. Check the control panel for evidence of moisture ingress.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Inspect for source of
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   any water.  Record any details in the Work Done area of
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   the job sheet and inform the Team Leader or his
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   representative.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	2. Check the doors and windows for damage, operation, lubricate
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   and repair as required and record in the Work Done area
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   of the Job Sheet.  Inform the Team Leader or his
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   representative of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	3. Clean and remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   cabinets, ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   settle on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   tops of cabinet doors,  tops of meter
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4. Clean exterior surfaces of cabinets where necessary.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   ceilings.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6. Remove from site all accumulated rubbish and debris.  Empty

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to leaving
the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for
fluorescent, Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
2. On access the pump station control panel, be aware of the
   atmosphere, use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to
   monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
3. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of
   the job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
   corrective actions.  [_ _]
4. Reference Manual TOJV Pump Station Operation and Maintenance
   Manuals - M-STG-ME-20001. Volume 3.
5. WARNING:  BOTH THE WET WELL AND THE VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED
   CONFINED SPACES AND  MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED
   SPACE CONDITIONS.
   Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry
   TMI-3012-SA-0015.
6. At the Local Control Panel
   (a) Check the switchboard, situated beside the pump station,
       for local alarm conditions.   [_ _]
   (b) Carry out visual inspections both internally and
       externally of the control panel for         vandalism,
       damage, corrosion, insect infestation, moisture ingress,
       dust and grime (clean as required).   [_ _]
   (c) Check the cable connections for tightness and signs of
       overheating and inspect the electrical control
       equipment.   [_ _]
   (d) Record the pump hour run meter reading in the Work
       Done area of the job sheet.
7. Inspection of pump wet well and valve pit.
   (a) Remove the gatic covers from both the wet well and the
       valve pit, inspect both the wet well and the valve pit
       for general cleanliness and debris.  Clean if
       required.   [_ _]
   (b) Inspect the external condition of  the pipework and
       valves for evidence corrosion and leaks.  [_ _]
8. Switch the pump AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the MANUAL
   position.    [_ _]
   (a) Check  the position of the  pump non-return valve
       counterweight before starting the pump.   [_ _]
   (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running or
       vibration and abnormal noises. [_ _]
   (c) Check that the cabling to the pump for damage and that it
       is clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
   CAUTION:  Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
             alarm point as lack of submergence may cause
             pumpset damage.
9. Start the pump PSCR1 by pressing the START button.
    (a) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work
        Done area of the job sheet.  (FLC 52A.).
    (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration
        and abnormal noises.    [_  _]
    (c) Observe the level controller readout for variations,
        with respect to the operation of the pump.    [_  _]
    (d) Assess the pump discharge rate by observing that outflow
        issuing from the outlet pipe into the river.   [_ _]
    (e) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.  Check
        the operation of each non-return valve (NRV), as the
        water flow stops.  Indicators to the correct operation
        of the NRV would be, the NRV closing with an sharp
        audible metallic sound, the counterweight returning to
        its original position or lower , as well, backflow
        through the pump should cease within 30 seconds.  If a
        faulty closure is suspected, the pump should be
        re-started,  operated for 2 minutes and  the operation
        of the NRV should then be monitored again.  If a faulty
        closure is still suspected, report for corrective
        maintenance.    [_ _]
    (f ) Visually check the operation of the flap valve on the
         riverbank.  The valve should operate freely and shut
         tight to prevent backflow of any water  from the
         river.   [_ _]
10. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
    position.   [_ _]
11. Check the operation of  the float switches in the wet well.
    Manually trip the floats using hook bar from the surface,
    lifting up the High/High float and Low/Low floats
    respectively, then checking that the alarms were received at
    the Control Room.  [_ _]
12. When this job falls in either January, February or March.
    Lift the level controller sensor out of the protective
    conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the sensor base
    of all dirt and debris.   [_ _]
13.Test the operation of riverbank isolating valve by partially
   closing and then fully opening.  [_ _]
ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
1. Check the interior lighting for operation, replace or repair
   any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
2. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
   accessible equipment and components within the control
   panels.
   Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient
   plus 10C should be considered abnormal and must be noted in
   the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team
   Leader or his representative is informed of the
   abnormality.  [_ _]
3. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
   equipment and components for evidence of burn marks, unusual
   odours and overheating.  record anything abnormal in the
   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team
   Leader or his representative is informed of the
   abnormality.  [_ _]
4. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
   contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
5. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,
   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general
   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required
   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
   actions.   [_ _]
6. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
7. Inspect the electrical enclosures internally for dust, grime
   and condensation, clean enclosures of any accumulated dust,
   dirt and debris.  [_ _]
8. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
   obstructions.  [_ _]
9. Visually inspect systems, mounted within the control panel,
   for faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
   buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp replacement
   or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.   [_ _]
10. PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following.
   (a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators
       found to indicate abnormal conditions are to be logged in
       the work done area of the job sheet and a new job sheet
       raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
   (b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
       connections, screw connections, for security.  [_ _]
   (c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
       module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
   (d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the
       enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated dust
       and debris.  [_ _]
11. Clean lighting diffusers  and lens of accumulated dust and
    debris.  [_ _]
12. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
    accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.   Record
    anything abnormal in the Work Done area of the job
    sheet.   Record anything abnormal in the Work Done area
    of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his
    representative of outstanding actions.  [_ _]

Building (Control Panel) Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the control panel interior for evidence of moisture
   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform
   the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check the doors and windows for damage, operation, lubricate
   and repair as required and record in the Work Done area
   of the Job Sheet.  Inform the Team Leader or his
   representative of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
3. Clean and remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of
   cabinets, ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.
   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops
   of cabinets, tops of cabinet doors,  tops of meter
   escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
4. Clean exterior surfaces of cabinets where necessary.  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets and
   ceilings.  [_ _]
6. Remove from site all accumulated rubbish and debris.  Empty
   rubbish bins and replace liners.  [_ _]
7. Sweep and remove all accumulated dirt and dust from control
   panel interior.  [_ _]
8. Carry out Exterior Checks of control panel.
    (a)  Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the control
         panels for damage, erosion, graffiti.  [_ _]
    (b) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding the
        building for erosion and damage to surfaces, fences,
        gates, pavements   [_ _]
9. Remove any accumulated debris from the surrounds.  [_ _]
10. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
    (a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g.
        pumps etc.  [_ _]
    (b)  All Enclosures closed and locked.  [_ _]
    (c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
11. On completion of job record anything outside normal
    parameters
    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
         leaks
         lighting faults
         door damage
         evidence of structural damage to the Pump Station and
         equipment etc,  in the Work Done section of the job
         sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
         representative raise a new job for any repairs.
12. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area
    of the job sheet.       [_ _]
13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

5. Reference Manual, Traffic Management Systems - CCTV & AID
   Systems - Operators and Maintenance Manual,  (M-MCL-TM-1 511)
6. If it is necessary to isolate the camera power supply (24Vac)
   can be switched off at a GPO mounted in the junction box that
   services up to four AID cameras mounted locally to the
   cameras.
7. Camera and Camera Housing;
   (a) Visually inspect for vandalism, damage, corrosion,
       external evidence of moisture and any insect infestation.
      Surface insect spray  may be applied if necessary to the
      housing exterior but must not be applied to the interior
      of the housing or to the housing glass.
   (b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to
       mounts.   [_ _]
   (c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
       Rain-X cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
   (e) Only If there is evidence of moisture and or insect

1. The 12 month service of the air conditioner shall be carried
   out by the sub-contractor in the presence of the electrical
   electronic technician and in conjunction with the 3 monthly
   service.
2. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
3. Access to equipments rooms ERE02 and ERW06 is via the Grant
   Street Stairwell.  The equipment rooms are located on the
   mezzanine floor.  The Air Conditioner and the Condenser are
   mounted in one integral unit.
4. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
5. Check the electrical switchboard for
   (a) faulty indicating lamps   [_ _]
   (b) connections, contacts, wiring and or components that may
       be overheated.   [_ _]
6. Compare the meter readings of the motor current with the
   nameplate ratings.   [_ _]
7. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following electrical
   service:
   (a) Check switchboard for overload settings.   [_ _]
   (b) Check all electrical control equipment operations and
       calibration.   [_ _]
   (c) Check functionality and calibration of microprocessor
       based controls.   [_ _]
8. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
   service at the compressor.
   (a) Accurately assess and record compressor
       superheat.   [_ _]
   (b) Check and record the suction and discharge
       pressures.   [_ _]
   (c) Check that the suction and discharge pressures are normal
       and stable.   [_ _]
   (d) Check the setting and operation of the high and low
       pressure cut out switches. [_ _]
   (e) Confirm that the refrigerant charge is correct and that
       there are no leaks.   [_ _]
   (f) Check the crankcase heater for correct operation.   [_ _]
   (g) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),
       fit a new dryer if required.   [_ _]
   (h) Check that the compressor mounting rubbers are secure and
       serviceable.   [_ _]
9. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
   service at the evaporator.
    (a) Check the efficiency of the evaporator.   [_ _]
    (b) Check the evaporator air flow.   [_ _]
    (c) Check the evaporator fan operation for efficiency and
        rectify any degraded operation.   [_ _]
    (d) Check the evaporator for leaks, repair any faults
        found.   [_ _]
    (e) Check the filter media for efficiency and operation, fit
        a new filter if required.   [_ _]
10. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
    service at the condenser.
     (a) Check the condenser air flow.   [_ _]
     (b) Check the cooling fan(s) operation for efficiency and
         rectifying any degraded operation.   [_ _]
     (c) Check the condenser for leaks, repair any faults
         found.   [_ _]
11. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
    service at the humidifier   (where fitted).
    (a) Check the humidifier inlet water strainer for
        blockage.   [_ _]
    (b) Check the humidifier operation.   [_ _]
12. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
14. If sub contractor costs are unknown use the amount entered
    in the Estimated Job Costs as an additional cost in the
    transactions.  Use Sub-contractor Costs - Outside Services.

The message should last about ten seconds.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

1. Notify the Traffic Control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference Manual: Australian Sound Service - Emergency Paging
   System Manual - M-MCL-CU-20001.
3. Use vehicle arrow board and short term lane stoppage
   Translink Procedure , PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 20, 22, 23.
4. This job involves whilst visiting all the odd numbered fire
   cabinets to:
  (a) listen to manual announcements over the emergency loud
      speakers as well as
  (b) at fire cabinet B23  listen to an automatic announcement
      and
  (c) at fire cabinet B45  listen to an ALL announcement.
  (d) listen to the announcement, in each case, and evaluate
      for:-
      (i) Clarity - e.g. message should be clear and
          understandable
     (ii) Volume - e.g. Clearly hear message, hear above ambient
          noise.  A suitable volume should be QUITE loud in the
          tunnel.
    (iii) Listen and be aware for non-functioning loud speakers
          and loud speakers with degraded output.  The speakers
          are mounted at 30m intervals throughout the tunnel
     Record the result of  your evaluation on form TUNNEL
     EMERGENCY PAGING SYSTEM - BURNLEY TUNNEL PA LOUD SPEAKER
     TEST - TMF-3012-OP-0365

   SPEAKER TEST - TMF-3012-OP-0365 to the Electrical/Electronics
   Supervisor or his representative for evaluation.

1. Work shall be carried out in designated times approved by the
   TCR.
2. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the Centre lane
3. Access to this camera group is:
   (a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
   (b) Position 0 and 1.
   (c) Lane Closure: Centre lane.
   (d) Electrical Cabinet Location: Above LHS
4. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
   Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink  Procedure,
   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 27.
5. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
   Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
6. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
   (a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
       moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
       necessary.   [_ _]
   (b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
       cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
   (c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
       re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
   (d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
       fastened to the PT300.
   WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
   CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
   (e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if
       not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]
   (f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
       the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
      (Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the camera).
       Ensure the co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
       module and is secure.  [_ _]
7. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
   (unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
   inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
   of the PTZ .  [_ _]
8. Camera and Camera Housing;
   WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
   ALIVE.
   (a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
       moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface insect
       spray may be applied if necessary to the housing exterior
       but must not be applied to the interior of the housing or
       to the housing glass.  If ingress of moisture or insect
       infestation is evident then carry out steps (d)
       and (e).  [_ _]
   (b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
       mounts. [_ _]
   (c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
       Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
   (d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
   WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.  If
   the heaters are not warm, spray the heater thermostat (HTR)
   with FREEZE IT, then again check the operation of the
   heater.   [_ _]
   (e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
       with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
9. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
   re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
   controller.  [_ _]
10. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
    full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
    to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait 2
    minutes then check again.  [_ _]
11. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,
    Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,
    public address loud speakers and cables and any other
    equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
    (a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
        Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
        attention of the Team Leader Electrical or his
        representative.
12. On completion of job record anything outside normal
    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.

1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference: Melbourne City Link - The Stick Wall Periodic
   Non-Destructive Testing - Scope.
   Report No. 4199/002 Provided by Intico.
3. Refer to "Red Stick Wall  Inspections - Stick Inspectional
   Location Details" TMF-3012-OP-0356 for the location of the
   various components and structural items for inspection.
Item 3.1
(a) Visually inspect, from the access door, the base and
    interior of each stick looking for water pooling in the
    base, evidence of moisture and or corrosion.
(b) Visually inspect the seal of the access door for damage
(c) Examine stick interior for evidence of the source of any
    possible leak e.g. Top cover or access door.
(d) Estimate the depth and quantity of any water residue and
    record.
(d) Record details of any water residues (along with source),
    corrosion and or damage on form "ANNUAL NORTH STICK
    INSPECTION"  TMF-3012-OP-0352.  Raise a new jobsheet for any
    outstanding works.
Item 3.2
(a) Visually inspect, from the ground and using binoculars, all
    faces of each stick, examining the protective coating for
    cracks, peeling, blisters and evidence of corrosion.
(b) Record details of any degradation of protective coating and
    or corrosion on form"ANNUAL NORTH STICK INSPECTION"
    TMF-3012-OP-0352.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
    works.
Item 3.3
(a) Visually inspect the Foundation to Stick seal.  Examine for
    the effectiveness of the elastic seal between the steelwork
    and the concrete foundation.  Seal may separate from the
    surfaces or may be missing.
(b) Record details of any degradation of the seal material and
    or any damaged or missing material on form "ANNUAL NORTH
    STICK INSPECTION" TMF-3012-OP-0352.  Raise a new jobsheet
    for any outstanding works.
Item 3.4
(a) Visually examine each stick for signs of structural damage.
    This would include vandalism, impact and or displacement.
 Examine the linearity of each stick against the remainder of
 the group. .
(b) Inspect the access door, at the base, for damage and a full
     complement of setscrews.
(c) Record details of any structural damage along with all other
    visible damage on form "ANNUAL NORTH STICK INSPECTION"
    TMF-3012-OP-0352.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
    works.
4. Notify the Traffic Control room on completion of the job.

1. Approximately 10% of smoke dampers in the tunnel are to be
   inspected annually.
   The Team Leader Electrical shall obtain the previous year
   check sheet TMF-3012-OP-0258 and use to allocated dampers to
   be inspected with this job sheet.
2. Obtain Permit to Work for operation of smoke damper by TCRO.
3. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
4. Reference Manual: TROX Technik - Melbourne City Link Tunnel
   Project, Operating & Maintenance Instructions Manual
   M-STG-VE-26100.
5. Access to the tunnel shall be as per Work Instruction,
   Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,
   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 23,24,25, and 26. Use the Plan best suited
   to the smoke dampers circled for inspection on check sheet
   ""DOMAIN TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER INSPECTION - 12 M INSPECTION OF
   DOMAIN TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER OPERATION"" TMF-3012-OP-0258
6. Carry out inspection of smoke dampers circled on check sheet
   ""DOMAIN TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER INSPECTION - 12 M INSPECTION OF
   DOMAIN TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER OPERATION"" TMF-3012-OP-0258 using
   the elevated work platform in B mode.  Note that either the
   LHS or the RHS or both sides of a nominated damper may
   require inspection.
7. Request the TCRO to open and then close the smoke dampers,
   that are to be inspected.
8. Observe the damper blades for non-standard operation such as
   (a) dampers that open or close sluggishly
   (b) dampers that  fail to open or close completely
   (c) dampers that move sluggishly.
   (d) Record an OK or FAIL result on check sheet  ""DOMAIN
   TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER INSPECTION - 12 M INSPECTION OF DOMAIN
   TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER OPERATION"" TMF-3012-OP-0258
9.  Repeat step 8 for all dampers to be inspected.
10. Note the Condition Rating for the dampers tested
11. Record in Work done area of Job sheet any dampers that have
    failed operation and raise new job sheet for repair.
    Priority High P1.
12. Notify the TCR on completion of the job.
13. On completion of the job, forward check sheet  ""DOMAIN
    TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER INSPECTION - 12 M INSPECTION OF
    DOMAIN TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER OPERATION"" TMF-3012-OP-0258 to
    the Team Leader Electrical or representative for sign off. "

A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of the Pump Station as well the cleaning,
inspections and maintenance of the relevant areas.
B PUMP AND PUMP CONTROL OPERATION
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference Manual, TOJV, Pump Station Operation and
   Maintenance Manuals - M-STG-ME-20001. Volume 3.
3. WARNING:  THE WET WELL IS DESIGNATED A CONFINED SPACE AND
   MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED SPACE CONDITIONS.
   Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry
   TMI-33012-SA-0015.  Ensure the vent fan has operated for a
   minimum period of 15 minutes prior to entering the dry well.
4. At the Local Control Panel
   (a) Check the switchboard, situated adjacent to the pump well
       for local alarm conditions.   [_ _]
   (b) Carry out visual inspections both internally and
       externally the control panel for damage, corrosion,
       evidence of insect infestation, ingress of moisture, dust
       and grime (clean as required).   [_ _]
   (c) Check the cable connections for tightness and signs of
       overheating and inspect the electrical control
       equipment.  [_ _]
   (d) Replace any failed panel indicator lamps.  [___]
   (e) Record the hours run reading in the Work Done area of
       the job sheet.   [_ _]
5. Inspect the wet well.
   (a) Remove the covers (gatic lifters required) from the wet
       well.
   (b) Inspect for general cleanliness and accumulated debris in
       the wet well, hose down any pumpable materials and remove
       any non-pumpable solids.   [_ _]
6.  Inspection of the dry well, pumps and valves.
   (a) Inspect the dry well for general cleanliness and
       accumulated debris, clean if required.   [_ _]
    (b) The pipes, valves and pumps for corrosion and evidence
        of leaks.   [_ _]
7. Check the water level in the low level pump area.  If the
   water level is above the high level setting then manually
   operate the sump pump to drain if necessary.   Record in the
   Work Done of the job sheet and report for corrective
   maintenance.   [_ _]
8. Switch the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to MANUAL
   position.   [_ _]
   (a) Check the cabling to the pump for damage and that it is
       clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
9. Start the pump PSYBSWP1 by pressing the START pushbutton.
   (a) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work
       Done area of the job sheet.   [_ _]
   (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration
       and that sufficient gland water flows regularly.  (One to
       two drops per minute)   [_ _]
   (c) Observe that the pump discharge is sufficient to drawdown
       the water level.    [_ _]
      CAUTION:  Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
      alarm point as lack of submergence may cause pumpset
      damage.
   (d) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton. Check the
       operation of non-return valve (NRV), as the flow stops.
       The NRV should close with
      (i) a sharp audible metallic sound
     (ii) the counterweight returning to pre-start position or
          lower, as well
    (iii) backflow through the pump should cease within 30
          seconds.
          If a faulty closure is suspected, the pump should be
          re-started and run for 2 minutes and  the operation of
          the NRV monitored again.   [_ _]
          If a faulty closure is still suspected, record in the
          Work Done  area of the job sheet and report for
          corrective maintenance.  [_ _]
10. Repeat steps 8 and  9 for pump PSYBSWP2.   [_ _]
11. Repeat steps 8 and  9 for pump PSYBSWP3.   [_ _]
12. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
    position. [_ _]
13. Check the operation of the Taylor level controller, using
    the wet well sight gauge situated on the wall of the dry
    well.   [_ _]
14. Test the operation of each of the isolating valves, in turn,
    by partial closing and fully opening again.    [_ _]
15. Check that the dry well ventilation system is functional by
    checking the air flow and the filters for blockages.  [_ _]
16. On completion of job record anything outside normal
    parameters
    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
         leaks
         lighting faults
         door damage
         evidence of structural damage to the Pump Station and
         equipment etc,  in the Work Done  section of the
         job sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
         representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
17. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done
    area of the job sheet.
18. Notify the control room on completion of the job.


C  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
1. On entering control rooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation
   fans, if operating.   [_ _]
2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,
   use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
   abnormal events.  [_ _]
3. Check the interior and external lighting for operation,
   including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace
   faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
4. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
   accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
   and distribution panels.
   Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient
   plus 10C should be considered abnormal and must be noted in
   the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team
   Leader or his representative is informed of the abnormality.
   Raise a new job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
5. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
   terminals, equipment and components  for evidence of burn
   marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything
   abnormal in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and raise
   a new jobsheet for any corrective action. Ensure the Team
   Leader or his representative is informed of the
   abnormality.   [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
   contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
7. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,
   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general
   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required
   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
   actions.  [_ _]
8. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
9. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
   dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
   accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
10. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
    Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
11. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for
    faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
    buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp replacement
    or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
    actions.   [_ _]
12. PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
   (a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators
       found to indicate abnormal conditions are to be logged in
       the work done area of the job sheet and a new job sheet
       raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
   (b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
       connections, screw connections, for security.  [_ _]
   (c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
       module security screws are not
       loose.  [_ _]
   (d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the
       enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated dust
       and debris.  [_ _]
13. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
    accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.  [_ _]
14. Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
   Leader or his representative of any corrective
   actions.  [_ _]
D. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform
   the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and
   or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
4. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,
   ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on
   all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops of
   cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
5. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
   cleaning materials .  [_ _]
6. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
   fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
7. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
8. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
9. Carry out Exterior checks of the Yarra Boulevard Pump station
   building.
   (a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the building
       for damage, erosion, graffiti.  [_ _]
   (b) Visually inspect the building walls, roof, guttering and
       downpipes for damage, leaks and or blockages, remove any
       debris or materials that could cause a blockage.  [_ _]
   (c) Inspect the general area surrounding the building for
       erosion and damage to surfaces, fences, gates,
       pavements   [_ _]
10. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait
    station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
11. Check for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
    Record any positive infestations in the Work Done area
    of the job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
   corrective actions.  [_ _]
12. Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.  [_ _]
13. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
   (a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g.
        Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
   (b) All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
   (c) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
14. Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
    Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
    Leader or his representative of any corrective
    actions.  [_ _]
15. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.

1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the right hand
   lane or mounting the median strip
2. Access to this camera group is:
   (a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
   (b) Position 0 and 1.
   (c) Lane Closure: RHS lane
   (d) Electrical Cabinet Location: Tollway
3. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic
   Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink  Procedure,
   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12.
4. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
   Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
   (a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
       moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
       necessary.   [_ _]
   (b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
       cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
   (c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
       re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
   (d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
       fastened to the PT300.
    WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
    CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
   (e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if
       not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]
   (f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
       the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
      (Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the camera).
      Ensure the co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
      module and is secure.  [_ _]
6. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
   (unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
   inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
    of the PTZ .  [_ _]
7. Camera and Camera Housing;
   WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
   ALIVE.
   (a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
       moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface insect
       spray may be applied if necessary to the housing exterior
       but must not be applied to the interior of the housing or
       to the housing glass.  If ingress of moisture or insect
       infestation is evident then carry out
       steps (d) and (e).  [_ _]
   (b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
       mounts. [_ _]
   (c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
      "Rain-X " cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
   (d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
       WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.
      If the heaters are not warm, spray the heater thermostat
     (HTR) with FREEZE IT, then again check the operation of the
      heater. [_ _]
   (e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
       with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
8. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
   re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
   controller.  [_ _]
9. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
   full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
   to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait 2
   minutes then check again.  [_ _]
10. On completion of job record anything outside normal
    parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job sheet.

A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of
Equipment Rooms, as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of
the relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
( Equipment Rooms ERE01 - ERE 16 and ERW 01 - ERW 06)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Equipment rooms, Technical
shelters and
    Substations.
2. On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation fans, if
operating (fans not
    required to be  switched OFF in technical shelters and appropriate
equipment
    rooms).   [_ _]
3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere, use your
senses of sight, smell
   and hearing to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including theoperational
tube within
   EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
fixture.  [_ _]
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
equipment and
   components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
   Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus
10C should be
   considered abnormal and must be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of
the Job Sheet and
   ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
abnormality. Raise a new
   job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
terminals, equipment and
   components  for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and
overheating.  Record
   anything abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and
raise a new jobsheet
   for any corrective action. Ensure the Team Leader or his
representative is informed of
   the abnormality.  [_ _]
7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
contactors for chattering,
    arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets,
seals and escutcheons
   for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required.
 Carry out any required
   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
looseness, and
    damage.  [_ _]
10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for dust,
grime and condensation,
     clean enclosures of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  Clean
or replace filters as
     required. [_ _]
12. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty
indicators,
      faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out
repairsor indicator lamp
      replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.
  [_ _]
13.  PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
   (a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators found
toindicate abnormal
        conditions are to be logged in the work done area of the job
sheet and a new job sheet
         raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
   (b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
connections, screw
         connections, for security.  [_ _]
   (c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and module
security screws are not
         loose.  [_ _]
   (d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the enclosure and
PLC modules
         are cleaned of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
14. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for accumulated
debris, evidence of water
      accumulation, where applicable.
15. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for operation
and security.  Check
     with the Traffic Control Room Operator to confirm the receipt of
analarm.  Repair
     faulty of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding
defects in the ""Work Done""
     area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
16.   Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the ""Work
Done"" area of the
      Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of any
corrective
      actions.  Include in the ""Related Job"" field of the new and
thisjob, the job number
      of the alternate Job.   [_ _]

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Notify the control room of the areas that will be effected
   during this test.
3. Refer to Australian Standard AS/NZS 2293.2 : 1995.  This
   standard sets out the procedure to be adopted when testing
   and proving the operation of battery backed emergency
   lighting.
4. Ensure that no interruption to the normal supply has taken
   place for a period of at least 16 hours prior to conducting
   this discharge test.   [_ _]
5. Replace fluorescent lamps that exhibit excessive
   end-blackening, even when the lamps still operate.  Record on
   EMERGENCY LIGHTING DISCHARGE TEST - SUBSTATION 6 AND
   OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE BUILDING TMF-3012-OP-0248, only
   those fittings in which the tubes have been replaced.
   EM/WP  - 2 x 18w tube
   EMG - 2 x 18w tube
   EMG 1 - 1 x 10w Tungston Halogen
   EMG 2 - 1 x 18w tube
   EMG E - 1 x 10w tube
   EX 1 - 2 x 10w tube
   EM 2 - 2 x 26w tube
6. Simulate a failure of the monitored power supply for
   90 minutes. Monitor the lights and record on EMERGENCY
   LIGHTING DISCHARGE TEST - SUBSTATION 6 AND OPERATIONS AND
   MAINTENANCE BUILDING TMF-3012-OP-0248, only those lights
   which does not provide suitable area lighting for the
   required 90 minutes.
7. Restore the emergency lights and exit signs to normal
   condition and then check that the battery charger
   operation indicator functions correctly.  Record on EMERGENCY
   LIGHTING DISCHARGE TEST - SUBSTATION 6 AND OPERATIONS AND
   MAINTENANCE BUILDING TMF-3012-OP-0248, only those light
   fittings that the battery charger operation indicator does
   not function correctly.
8. Clean all light emitting and reflecting surfaces of the
   emergency lights and exit signs. Record any broken or damaged
   diffusers on the form EMERGENCY LIGHTING DISCHARGE TEST -
   SUBSTATION 6 AND OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE BUILDING
   TMF-3012-OP-0248 for subsequent replacement.
9. Ensure the emergency lighting and exit signs operate in the
   correct relationship to the normal lighting.
10. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
    parameters in the Work Done area of the of the job sheet.
11. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job as well as prior
to entering the stairwell.
2. (a) Refer to Maintenance Manual, ""Operating and Maintenance manual
for Mechanical
         Services - MCL Tunnels"" M-STG-ME-27400.
   (b) Refer to AS 1668.1 - Appendix A for detail and methodology of
stair pressurisation
         commissioning tests.
3. Check under the fan cowl and the exit grills for debris that could
restrict the airflow.  [_ _]
4. Ensure the door between Domain Tunnel and the stairwell is closed.
 [_ _]
5. Request the TCO to start the fan ESF-P05 from the TCR.  Ensure the
fan starts.  Check
    that the airflow direction is into the stairwell.  [_ _]
6. (a) NOTE: The alarm to be raised will not call the fire brigade.  It
will register on the local FIP
          and the CCCS as a local alarm.
    (b) Remove the access cover over the smoke detector, direct ""test
smoke"" from a smoke
         generator, as specified on the container, onto the smoke
detector (on the inlet duct).
         Check that an alarm actuates on the local fire indicator panel.
The smoke detector must
         be in fault for approx 2 mins for the fan to stop and for an
alarm to genrate on
         the CCCS.  [_ _]
7. Check and inspect the Stairwell area.
   (a) Check each door for damage, as well check the rollers, runners,
hinges, handles,
         catches, and counter-weights for efficient operation.  [_ _]
   (d) With the supply air fan (ESF-P05) operating, record the
differential air pressure within
         the stairwell and at substation level.  Record readings less
than 50Pa in the ""Work Done'
         area of the Job sheet. Notify the superintendent for further
investigation.  [_ _]
   (e) At each of the doors, starting from the tunnel and working
towards the fan.
          Arrange the door catch to be non-functioning, then using a
spring balance, measure the
          force required to open the door.  Record the results in the
Work Done"" area of the Job
          sheet if a force greater than 11kg is required, as well
advisethe maintenance
          superintendent for further investigation.   [_ _]
    (f ) Check the time taken for the air pressure to return to the
static reading.  Record in the
          ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet if time is greater than 2
minutes. Notify the
          superintendent for further investigation.
    (g) Chock each door open, then using an anemometer, measure the
velocity of air out of the
          open door.  The reading is to be with the door fully open and
with no obstructions.
         Record the results in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job sheet
if the air flow is less than
        1 metre /sec as well advise the maintenance superintendent for
further investigation.  [_ _]
    (h) Check the fan and motor for undue noise and vibrations.   [_ _]
    (i ) Check the fan bearings for noise.   [_ _]
    (j ) Check the fan unit for damage, corrosion, missing panel
fixings, as well as checking
          the fixings of the unit for security.  [_ _]
8. Ensure the action of opening a stairwell door;
     (a) Generates an alarm at the TCR workstation.
     (b) Causes the fan speed to vary to maintain a positive pressure inthe
stairwell.
     (c) To replicate the action of the smoke detector, remove the
BATMAN AVENUE FAN alarm
           relay (mounted in the rear compartment  of the FIP) for at
least two and a half minutes to
           ensure the fan stops.  Replace the relay once the action is
confirmed  [_ _].  The fire
           brigade will not be called)
9. Run the fan for a further 5 minutes, with the door in both the open
and the closed position
   then advise the traffic control room to shut the fan down and to turnOFF
the lighting after
   leaving the stairwell, ensuring that the door to the tunnel is
closed.
10. Ensure the stairwell is clean and all rubbish and debris is removed
from the stairwell.  [_ _]
11. Record anything outside normal parameters in the ""Work Done"" area
of the Job Sheet.
12. Ensure the door between the stairwell and the Domain Tunnel is
closed.
13. Notify the Control Room on completion of the job.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Notify the control room of the areas that will be effected
   during this test.
3. Refer to Australian Standard AS/NZS 2293.2 : 1995.  This
   standard sets out the procedure to be adopted when testing
   and proving the operation of battery backed emergency
   lighting.
4. Ensure that no interruption to the normal supply has taken
   place for a period of at least 16 hours prior to conducting
   this discharge test.   [_ _]
5. Replace fluorescent lamps that exhibit excessive
   end-blackening, even when the lamps still operate.  Record on
   EMERGENCY LIGHTING DISCHARGE TEST - EQUIPMENT ROOMS AND
   REFUGES SUPPLIED FROM SUBSTATION 2 TMF-3012-OP-0244, only
   those fittings in which the tubes have been replaced.
   FA - 2 x 36w tube
   FB -2 x 36w tube (Haz area)
   FC - 1 x 18w tube
   EM2 - 2 x 36w tube
   EM3 - 2 x 36w tube
   EM4 - 2 x 18w tube
   EX1 - 2 x 10w tube
   EX2 - 2 x 10w tube
   EX3 - 2 x 10w tube
   EX4 - 2 x 10w tube
   EX5 - 2 x 10W tube
   EXB1 - 1 x 10w tube.
6. Simulate a failure of the monitored power supply for
   90 minutes. Monitor the lights and record on EMERGENCY
   LIGHTING DISCHARGE TEST - EQUIPMENT ROOMS AND REFUGES
   SUPPLIED FROM SUSTATION 2 TMF-3012-OP-0244, only those lights
   which does not provide suitable area lighting for the
   required 90 minutes.
7. Restore the emergency lights and exit signs to normal
   condition and then check that the battery charger operation
   indicator functions correctly.  Record on EMERGENCY LIGHTING
   DISCHARGE TEST - EQUIPMENT ROOMS AND REFUGES SUPPLIED FROM
   SUBSTATION 2 TMF-3012-OP-0244, only those light fittings that
   the battery charger operation indicator does not function
   correctly.
8. Remove any excess debris from within lighting diffusers.
9. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
   parameters in the Work Done area of the of the job sheet.
10. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
