    Location Details TMF-3012-OP-0357 for the location of the
    various components and structural items for inspection.
Item 1
(a) Visually inspect the external beam surfaces at frames CF 2
    and CF 3.  Inspect  for approx 1.5m distance in either
    direction from each of the two frame corners.  Inspect both
    the Northern and Southern sides of the beam.  Inspect for
    visible cracks in either the metal or the paint coating.
(b) Visually inspect the internal beam surfaces at frames CF 2
    and CF 3.  Inspect  for approx 1.5m distance in either
    direction from each of the two frame corners.  Inspect both
    the Northern and Southern sides of the beam.  Inspect for
    visible cracks in the outer shell.
(c) Record all details of any evidence of damage, degradation,
    corrosion, cracking, and blistering of paint and or metal,
    on form Cantilever Beam Structural Inspection
    TMF-3012-OP-0358 for the Item 1 inspection.
Item 2
(a) Visually inspect the external skin plates in the area of the
    base plate to skin weld.
    Inspect from frame CF2 to the east end of the beam.  Inspect
    both the  Northern and Southern sides of the beam.  Inspect
    for visible cracks in either the metal of the skin plate or
    the paint coating.
(b) Visually inspect the internal skin plates in the area of the
    base plate to skin weld.
    Inspect from frame CF2 to the east end of the beam.  Inspect
    both the  Northern and Southern sides of the beam.  Inspect
    for visible cracks in the metal of the skin plate.
(c) Record all details of any evidence of damage, degradation,
    corrosion, cracking, and blistering of paint and or metal,
    on form Cantilever Beam Structural Inspection
    TMF-3012-OP-0358 for the Item 2 inspection.
Item 4
(a) Visually inspect the external skin plates in the lower areas
    of frame CF3.  Inspect from frame CF3 in either direction
    for approx 1m.  Inspect both the  Northern and Southern
    sides of the beam.  Inspect for visible cracks in either the
    metal of the skin plate or the paint coating.
(b) Visually inspect the internal skin plates in the lower areas
    of frame CF3.  Inspect from frame CF3 in either direction
    for approx 1m.  Inspect both the  Northern and Southern
    sides of the beam.  Inspect for visible cracks in the metal
    of the skin plate.
(c) Record all details of any evidence of damage, degradation,
    corrosion, cracking, and blistering of paint and or metal,
    on form Cantilever Beam Structural Inspection
    TMF-3012-OP-0358 for the Item 4 inspection.
Item 6
(a)  (i) Visually inspect the top corner welds on the South edge
         of frame CF2 (Frame top corner (1)). This is performed
         within the interior of the beam.  Inspect the welds for
         visible cracks.
    (ii) Visually inspect the brace to frame welds (2) on the
         southern edge of frame CF 2 (Frame to Brace welds (2)
         This is performed within the interior of the beam.
         Inspect the welds for visible cracks.
(b)  (i) Visually inspect the top corner welds on the North edge
         of frame CF2 (Frame top corner (1)). This is performed
         within the interior of the beam.  Inspect the welds for
         visible cracks.
    (ii) Visually inspect the brace to frame welds (2) on the
         northern edge of frame CF 2(Frame to Brace welds (2)).
         This is performed within the interior of the beam.
         Inspect the welds for  visible cracks.
(c) Record all details of any evidence of damage, degradation,
    corrosion, cracking, and blistering of paint and or metal,
    on form Cantilever Beam Structural Inspection
    TMF-3012-OP-0358 for the Item 6 inspection.
Item 8
(a)  (i) Visually inspect the top corner and bottom corner welds
         on the South edge of frame CF3 (Frame top corner (1) &
         bottom corner (1)). This is performed within the
         interior of the beam.   Inspect the welds for visible
         cracks.
    (ii) Visually inspect the brace to frame welds (4) on the
         southern edge of frame CF 3 (Frame to Brace welds
         (4)). This is performed within the interior of the
         beam. Inspect the welds for visible cracks.
   (iii) Visually inspect the bottom C channel to skin plate
         weld of frame CF3.   Inspect the welds for visible
             cracks.
(b)  (i) Visually inspect the top corner and bottom corner welds
         on the North edge of frame CF3 (Frame top corner (1) &
         bottom corner (1)). This is performed within the
         interior of the beam.   Inspect the welds for visible
         cracks.
    (ii) Visually inspect the brace to frame welds (4) on the
         northern edge of frame CF 3 (Frame to Brace welds (4)).
         This is performed within the interior of the beam.
              Inspect the welds for visible cracks.
(c) Record all details of any evidence of damage, degradation,
    corrosion, cracking, and blistering of paint and or metal,
    on form Cantilever Beam Structural Inspection
    TMF-3012-OP-0358 for the Item 8 inspection.
Item 10
(a)  (i) Visually inspect the brace to frame welds on the South
         half of frame CF1. This is performed within the
         interior of the beam.   Inspect the welds for visible
         cracks.
    (ii) Visually inspect the brace to frame welds on the North
         half of frame CF1. This is performed within the
         interior of the beam.  Inspect the welds for visible
         cracks.
(b) Record all details of any evidence of damage, degradation,
    corrosion, cracking, and blistering of paint and or metal,
    on form Cantilever Beam Structural Inspection
    TMF-3012-OP-0358 for the Item 10 inspection.
Item 11
(a)  (i) Visually inspect the Top web plates and web plate to

         Inspect the welds for visible cracks.
    (ii) Visually inspect the web plate to frame CF3 welds
         (Southern side) . This is performed within the interior
         of the beam.  Inspect the welds for visible cracks.
   (iii) Visually inspect the web plate to frame CF3 welds
         (Northern side) . This is performed within the interior

(b) Record all details of any evidence of damage, degradation,
    corrosion, cracking, and blistering of paint and or metal,
    on form Cantilever Beam Structural Inspection
    TMF-3012-OP-0358 for the Item 11 inspection.
Item 12
(a) (i) At frame CF3, visually inspect the bottom corner weld on
        the southern side
   (ii) At frame CF3, visually inspect the bottom corner weld
        on the northern side
  (iii) At frame CF3, on its southern side, visually inspect

   (iv) At frame CF3, on its southern side, visually inspect

        plates are the three closest to the southern side.
(b)  (i) At frame CF3, on its northern side, visually inspect

    (ii) At frame CF3, on its northern side, visually inspect

(c) Record all details of any evidence of damage, degradation,

    on form ""Cantilever Beam Structural Inspection""
    TMF-3012-OP-0358 for the Item 12 inspection.
Item 14
(a)  (i) Visually inspect in the areas between frames CF3
         through to CF7 and splice 1 on the southern side.
         Inspect for visible cracks of weld or the skin plates

    (ii) Visually inspect in the areas between frames CF3

(c) Record all details of any evidence of damage, degradation,

    TMF-3012-OP-0358 for the Item 14 inspection.

   Gantry Structures"".
5. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical Shelter.
6. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plkan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
   Preventative Maintenance No:
   1201: Inspect electrical Pump set
   1202: No procedure to check bolts are tightened.  Visually
   check accessible bolt markings to ascertain if any movement,
   inspect for corrosion.
   1204: Inspect cabinets for cleanliness, corrosion , damage,
   evidence of possible electrical malfunction, Inspect for
   corrosion, ingress of moisture, insect infestation, damage
   and security of all fasteners
   1205: Checking VDC sensors and connectors.
   The following Task is to be also carried out using extreme
   care to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter the Fibre
   Optic connectors or cables, ensure sufficient fibre optic
   cable is available to allow removal of the fibre optic
   connector (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
   NOTE: Ensure the fibre Optic Connector remains free of
   foreign matter.
   Carefully remove the Fibre Optic Connector, clean the
   connector body of any deposits. Take care to not touch the
   Fibre Optic pins within the connector (if touched or dirty,
   clean pins with Fibre Optic cleaner).
   Apply a light  coating of silicon spray to a cloth and wipe
   onto the Fibre Optic connector body, replace and exercise the
   Fibre Optic Connector release collar.
   Where connectors cannot be easily removed, record details in
   the "Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and report the fact
   to the Team Leader or his representative.
   1206: Clean VR Sensor Unit Vent with brush or similar

   number in the "Work Done" area of this job sheet and in the
   "Related Job" field of both jobs.

1. The 12 month service of the air conditioner shall be carried
   out by the sub-contractor in the presence of the electrical
   electronic technician and in conjunction with the 3 monthly
   service.
2. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
3. Set up the traffic control measures as per Work Instruction,
   Traffic Control, MI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,
   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 20
4. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne City
   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
5. Check the electrical switchboard for
   (a) faulty indicating lamps   [_ _]
   (b) connections, contacts, wiring and or components that may
       be overheated.   [_ _]
6. Compare the meter readings of the motor current with the
   nameplate ratings.   [_ _]
7. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following electrical
    service:
   (a) Check switchboard for overload settings.   [_ _]
   (b) Check all electrical control equipment operations and
       calibration.   [_ _]
   (c) Check functionality and calibration of microprocessor
       based controls.   [_ _]
8. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
   service at the compressor.
   (a) Accurately assess and record compressor
       superheat.   [_ _]
   (b) Check and record the suction and discharge
       pressures.   [_ _]
   (c) Check that the suction and discharge pressures are normal
       and stable.   [_ _]
   (d) Check the setting and operation of the high and low
       pressure cut out switches. [_ _]
   (e) Confirm that the refrigerant charge is correct and that
       there are no leaks.   [_ _]
   (f) Check the crankcase heater for correct operation.   [_ _]
   (g) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),
       fit a new dryer if required.   [_ _]
   (h) Check that the compressor mounting rubbers are secure and
       serviceable.   [_ _]
9. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
   service at the evaporator.
   (a) Check the efficiency of the evaporator.   [_ _]
   (b) Check the evaporator air flow.   [_ _]
   (c) Check the evaporator fan operation for efficiency and
       rectify any degraded operation.   [_ _]
   (d) Check the evaporator for leaks, repair any faults
       found.   [_ _]
   (e) Check the filter media for efficiency and operation, fit
       a new filter if required.   [_ _]
10. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
    service at the condenser.
    (a) Check the condenser air flow.   [_ _]
    (b) Check the cooling fan(s) operation for efficiency and
        rectifying any degraded operation.   [_ _]
    (c) Check the condenser for leaks, repair any faults
        found.   [_ _]
11. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
    service at the humidifier (where fitted).
   (a) Check the humidifier inlet water strainer for
       blockage.   [_ _]
   (b) Check the humidifier operation.   [_ _]
12. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
14. If sub contractor costs are unknown use the amount entered
    in the Estimated Job Costs as an additional cost in the
    transactions.  Use Sub-contractor Costs - Outside Services.

2. Reference: Melbourne City Link - Visual Inspection of the
   Beam Report No. 000624vi_005  Date 25 August 2003.
Item 15.1
(a) Inspect the interior of the beam structure at ground level
    for evidence of the entry of water or moisture.
(b) Travel the length of the beam and visually examine the full
    extent of each joint, looking for evidence of water ingress.
(c) At the junction of each cross-member and the lower face of
    the beam, visually inspect for evidence of accumulated water
    and or recent moisture.
(d) Whilst carrying out the above inspections, record any
    evidence of corrosion and or any degradation of internal
    surfaces.
(e) Record details of any water residues, corrosion and or
    damage on form ANNUAL BEAM INSPECTION TMF-3012-OP-0351.
Item 15.2
(a) Visually inspect the internal studs/nuts/packers at ground
    level for evidence of moisture and or recent wetness.
(b) Visually inspect the studs/nuts/packers at ground level for
    any evidence of corrosion.
(c) Record details of any water residues, corrosion and or
    damage on form ANNUAL BEAM INSPECTION TMF-3012-OP-0351.
Item 15.3
(a).Visually inspect, from the ground, all external surfaces
    and joints of the beam using binoculars.
    Examine for the integrity of the paint coating on the
    various faces, examine for peeling paint, blisters and
    evidence of corrosion.
    Record details of any outstanding works for surface coating
    damage, corrosion and or damage on form ANNUAL BEAM
    INSPECTION TMF-3012-OP-0351.  Raise a new jobsheet for any
    outstanding works.
Item 15.4
(a) Visually inspect the Beam to foundation connections
   (foundation studs) for signs of degradation or corrosion,
    inspect the protective coatings (Coverings and coatings)
    for integrity and degradation.
(b) Visually inspect grouting and paintwork for cracks,
    blistering, peeling and damage and any corrosion.
    Record details of any outstanding works required to correct
    cracks, chips or damage to the protective coatings on form
    ANNUAL BEAM INSPECTION TMF-3012-OP-0351.
    Raise a new job for outstanding works.
Item 15.5
(a) Visually inspect the foundation moat for effective drainage.
    Remove and clean all debris and materials from the moat.
    Ensure the moat drains effectively.
    Record details of outstanding works required to correct any
    water residues and or corrosion and or damage on form
    ANNUAL BEAM INSPECTION TMF-3012-OP-0351.
    Raise a new jobsheet for outstanding works.
Item 15.6
(a) Visually inspect the beam for signs structural damage like
    vandalism, impact or movement.
(b) Visually inspect the access door at the base of the beam to
    ensure it is intact and has a full complement of setscrews.
    Record details of any outstanding works for vandalism,
    impact and or movement on form ANNUAL BEAM INSPECTION
    TMF-3012-OP-0351.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
    works.
3. Notify the Traffic Control room on completion of the job.

A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the Pumps,
electrical installations and Control panel as well the cleaning,
inspections and maintenance of the related area.

B PUMP AND PUMP OPERATION
1. Notify the Control room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference Manual TOJV Pump Station Operation and Maintenance
   Manuals - M-STG-ME-20001. Volume 3.
3. WARNING: BOTH THE WET WELL AND THE VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED
   CONFINED SPACES AND  MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED
   SPACE CONDITIONS.
   Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry
   TMI-3012-SA-0015.
4. Inspect the Local Control Panel
   (a) Check the switchboard, located in Sub-station 5, for
       local alarm conditions.
   (b) Carry out visual inspection both internally and
       externally of the control panel for damage, corrosion,
       evidence of insect infestation, ingress of moisture, dust
       and grime (clean as required).   [_ _]
   (c) Check the cable connections for tightness and signs of
       overheating, inspect the electrical control
       equipment.   [_ _]
  (d) Record readings of the hour run meters,  for each pump, in
      the Work Done area of the job sheet .   [_ _]
5. Inspection of pump wet well and valve pit.
   (a) Remove the gatic covers from both the wet well and the
       valve pit, inspect both the wet well and the valve pit
       for general cleanliness and debris.  Clean if
       required.   [_ _]
   (b) Inspect the external condition of  the pipework and
       valves for evidence corrosion and leaks.  [_ _]
6. Switch the pump AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the MANUAL
   position.
   (a) Measure and record the operating current and compare with
       the rated (80A) current.   [_ _]
   (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running or
       vibration and abnormal noises. [_ _]
   (c) Check that the cabling to the pump for damage and that it
       is clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
  CAUTION: Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
  alarm point as lack of submergence may cause pumpset damage.
7. Start pump PSOPP1 (Pump A1 starter) by pressing the START
   pushbutton.   [_ _]
   (a) Record the operating current of the pump, in the Work
       Done area of the job sheet.     [_ _]
   (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration
       and abnormal noises.   [_ _]
   (c) Observe the level controller readout for variations, with
       respect to the operation of the pump.    [_  _]
   (d) Observe that the pump drawdown rate is sufficient to draw
       down the water level in the wet well.    [_ _]
   (e) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.  Check the
       operation of the non-return (NRV), as the water flow
       stops.  The NRV should close with a sharp audible
       metallic sound, as well, backflow through the pump should
       cease within 30 seconds.  If a faulty closure is
       suspected, the pump should be re-started, operated
       for 2 minutes and the operation of the NRV should then be
       monitored again.  If a  faulty closure is still
       suspected, record the details in the Work Done area of
       the Job sheet, and report for corrective
       maintenance.    [_ _]
8. Repeat step 7 for PSOPP2 (Pump A2 starter).    [_ _]
9. Repeat step 7 for PSOPP3 (Pump B1 starter).    [_ _]
10. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
    position.      [_ _]
11. Check the operation of the float switches.  Manually trip
    the floats from the valve pit by lifting up the High/High
    float and the Low/Low floats respectively with a hook bar
    and then checking that the alarms were received at the
    Control Room.     [_ _]
12. When this job falls in either January, February or March.
    Lift the level controller sensor out of the protective
    conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the sensor base
    of all dirt and debris.   [_ _]
13. Test the operation of the isolating valves by partially
    closing and the fully re-opening.     [_ _]
14. On completion of job record anything outside normal
    parameters
    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
         leaks
         lighting faults
         door damage
     evidence of structural damage to the Pump Station and
     equipment etc, in the Work Done section of the job sheet
     and report to the Team Leader or his representative and
     raise a new job for any repairs.
15. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area
    of the job sheet.    [_ _]
16. Notify the control room that the inspection has been
    completed.

C  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
1. On accessing the control panel(s), be aware of the
   atmosphere, use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to
   monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
2. Check the interior lighting of the control panel for
   operation, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting
   fixture.  [_ _]
3. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
   accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
   and distribution panels.  Use an Infra-red temperature
   sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus 10C should be
   considered abnormal and must be noted in the Work Done area
   of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team Leader or his
   representative is informed of the abnormality.  Raise a new
   job sheet for any corrective action   [_ _]
4. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
   terminals, equipment and components for evidence of burn
   marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything
   abnormal in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and raise a
   new jobsheet for any corrective action.  Ensure the Team
   Leader or his representative is informed of the
   abnormality.  [_ _]
5.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
    contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
6. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,
   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general
   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required
   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
   actions.  [_ _]
7. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
8. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
   dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
   accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
9. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
   Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
10. Inspect systems, mounted within the control panel(s), for
    faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
    buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp
    replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
    actions.   [_ _]
11. PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
   (a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators
       found to indicate abnormal conditions are to be logged in
       the work done area of the job sheet and a new job sheet
       raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
   (b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
       connections, screw connections, for security.  [_ _]
   (c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
       module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
   (d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the
       enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated dust
       and debris.  [_ _]
12. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
    accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.
13. Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
    Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
    or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]

D. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the control panel interior for evidence of moisture
   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform the
   Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the control panel(s) are not obstructed by
   furnishings and or stored items.  Remove any
   obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,
   ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on
   all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops of
   cabinet doors, tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
   cleaning materials .  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from cabinets, light fittings and
   cable trays .  [_ _]
6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
7. Sweep and vacuum the floor surfaces at the control
   panel(s).  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait
   station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
   job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
   corrective actions.  [_ _]
10. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
    (a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
        e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]
    (b) All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
    (c) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
11. Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
    Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
    or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
12. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.

1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job
2. Access to both ERE 03 and ERW 05 is via the Grant Street

   ACU Air Conditioning Units are located in the respective
   equipment rooms, while the condenser units are mounted on the
   Mezzanine level above the equipment rooms.
3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne City
   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
     vibration.   [_ _]
4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
     a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
        LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
        measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
        temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
        setting.   [_ _]
     b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
        the following steps
        (i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
            displayed)
       (ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
      (iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
            setting.
       (iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
        (v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
       (vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that
            temperature shown on unit is consistent with new
            setpoint and verify temperature is consistent with
            ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
            thermometer.   [_ _]
     c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
        original setting.   [_ _]
     d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
        point is reached and verify that the temperature is
        consistent with ambient using the portable
        thermometer.   [_ _]
     NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
     cycle.
4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
     and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary   Filter type
     Liebert size 650x590x75 mm
4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
     is clear.   [_ _]
4.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
     operation.   [_ _]
5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
     running.   [_ _]
5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local fan isolating
     switch.   [_ _]
5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
5.6. Clean the condenser coils if required using compressed
     air.   [_ _]
5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local fan isolator.   [_ _]
5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
     Unit.   [_ _]

These checks are carried out to verify the operability of the
Ventilation Station smoke duct damper actuators for each
Ventilation Station.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
2. In conjunction with Traffic Control Room Operators set TCR
   PMCS system smoke damper actuator controls for manual
   operation
3. Open a minimum of 4 smoke duct dampers upstream of the
   ventilation station to prevent negative pressure being
   generated in the smoke duct, from the normal ventilation
   system, when smoke dampers are opened.
4. Open and close each damper at least  twice and observe the
   panel for indications of non- standard operation such as
   dampers that open or close sluggishly, or fail to open or
   close completely.
5. Close the Ventilation station smoke duct dampers.
6. Close tunnel smoke duct dampers.
7. Record in Work Done area of the Job Sheet those dampers that
   have suspect operation.
8. Notify the control room om completion of the job.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

2. Refer to and read TMI-3012-SA-0122 ""Floating Elevated Work
   Platform"" procedure prior to commencing job for safety
   procedures to be followed whilst carrying out this job.
3. Whilst Inspecting the lighting fittings:-
   (a) Change the lamps
   (b) Check flexible hose connections for damage etc, repair
       any damage found.
   (c) Check all seals for damage and leaks, replace any seals
       found to be faulty
   (d) Check the lighting control gear and connections for
       damage, overheating and operation, repair and or
       replace faulty components.
   (e) Check the light fitting for damage and or corrosion.
       Repair damaged or faulty light fittings and components
       that are damaged.  Record in the ""Work Done"" area of
       the Job Sheet the number of lamps replaced, as well
       indicate on form TMF-3012-OP-0220 Architectural Feature
       Lighting - Red Stick (South) the position of fittings
       changed.
   (f) Inspect glass lens for damage replace as required and
       clean the glass lens of all dirt, dust and or grime.
   (g) Remove any debris accumualted within the light fitting.
   (h) Apply anti-seize to all threads replaced in light
       fitting.
4. Remove and return to store the Red filters (300000688) , and
   install yellow filters (300000686) on the light fittings.
5. Repair any damaged Red filters (300000688) and record
   details in ""Work Done"" area
   of the Job Sheet and report any damage to the Team leader
   or his representitive.
6. Notify the TCRO on completion of the job.

1. Work shall be carried out in designated times approved by the
   TCR.
2. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
3. Location to this camera group is:
   CCTV 653 is mounted on the South wall of Substation 2 Bldg -
   Control box mtd on wall in Sub2A
   CCTV 783 is located on stairway and looks at Refuge 3 door.
   CCTV 784 which is located on Nth wall of refuge 3, the camera
   is accessed by a 2m ladder.
   Control box for refuge 3 cameras located on wall in refuge 3.
   (a) Access vehicle: Swan St Shaft and Substation 2 Bldg.
   (b) Lane Closure : N/A
   (c) Electrical Cabinet Location: In refuge 3 and accessed by
      a 2m ladder..
   (d) Access to camera and panel: 2m Ladder.
4. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,
   Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
   (a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
       moisture and any insect infestation, clean if
       necessary.   [_ _]
   (b) Inspect the cabinet and check that  the equipment mounted
       in the cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
   (c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,
       re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
   (d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
       fastened to the PT300.
    WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
    CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
   (e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if
       not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]
   (f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
       the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
      (Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the camera)
    .  Ensure the co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
       module and is secure.  [_ _]
6. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
   (unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
   inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
   of the PTZ .  [_ _]
7. Camera and Camera Housing;
   WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
   ALIVE.
   (a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of
       moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface insect
       spray may be applied if necessary to the housing exterior
       but must not be applied to the interior of the housing or
       to the housing glass.  If ingress of moisture or insect
       infestation is evident then carry out
       steps (d) and (e).  [_ _]
   (b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
       mounts. [_ _]
   (c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
       "Rain-X " cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
   (d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm.
       WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.
       If the heaters are not warm, spray the heater thermostat
      (HTR) with FREEZE IT, then again check operation of the
       heater. [_ _]
   (e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
       with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
8. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
   re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
   controller.  [_ _]
9. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
   full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
   to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait
   2 minutes then check again.  [_ _]
10. On completion of job record anything outside normal
    parameters in the "Work Done" area of the job sheet.

5. TSH 08 - UPS Unit.
   (a) Do not operate the EMERGENCY STOP push button, on the
   front of the UPS Panel, unless in an extreme emergency, as
   damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.
   (b) Check operation, settings and calibration of all
   controls.  [_ _]
   (c)  Record from the data display, the input, inverter, load
   and battery data.   [_ _]
   (d)  Check for signs of over heating.  [_ _]
   (e)  Check system safety controls. (Bypass operations)  [_ _]
   (f ) Clean the inside of the UPS. (Vacuum out)  [_ _]
   (g)  Clean the filter on the inside of the door panel.  [_ _]
6. TSH 08 - Battery Panel.
   (a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
   Batteries.
   (b) Remove any metal jewellery being worn
   (c) Battery discharge test.  [_ _]
         Using the discharge tester, measure and record the
         individual standby and discharge
         voltages on the "" individual battery check ""  sheet.
        (Cell voltage variation limit + / - 0.05% volts per cell
         from average of all cells in (1) one
         battery bank.  Any variation in excess of this limit
         should be investigated immediately.)
         Using the ""Mains failure simulation"" sheet, perform
         test and record voltages & currents.
   (d) Check terminals for corrosion.  [_ _]
   (e) Check connections for tightness .  [_ _]

8. TSH 09 - Battery Panel.
   (a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
   Batteries.
   (b) Remove any metal jewellery being worn
   (c) Battery discharge test.  [_ _]
         Using the discharge tester, measure and record the

         voltages on the "" individual battery check ""  sheet.
        (Cell voltage variation limit + / - 0.05% volts per cell

         battery bank.  Any variation in excess of this limit
         should be investigated immediately.)
         Using the ""Mains failure simulation"" sheet, perform

1. This work is to be carried out by suitably qualified personnel.
2. This work is for the OMB building.
3. Inspect the OMB fire doors to AS 1851.7 Type 1 inspection.  The
inspection shall consist of
    an examination of the condition of the door set and a check that it
is operating satisfactorily.
    In particular, the following routine should be followed.
3.1 Inspect for any remedial work that is outstanding and unfinished andrecord
works to be
      completed in the comments field.
3.2 Remove any obstructions or non-approved devices such as wedges,
heavy objects or
     hooks that are used to hold the door open.
3.3 Check that the door and all it's components, hardware and functions
are correct.
3.4 While the door is open, check that all screws are firm in the
hinges, latch set faceplate,
     striking plate and the door closer body and bracket.
3.5 Inspect that the door identification data notice, required by the
regulatory authority is firmly
      attached.  The notice is generally mounted on the door edge and
onthe door frame.
3.6 Check the closing and latching action (on the closing), and that
thedoor stopping action
      (fully open limit) is functioning (on the opening).
3.7 With the door closed, check that the leaf is a reasonably even fit
in the frame.
4. Record the result of the inspection for each door on ""Operations
& Maintenance Building
    Fire Door Inspection"" form TMF-3012-OP-0279
5. (a) Check the fire hydrant at the property front entrance for damage
,leakage.   [_ _]
    (b) Trim plants and foliage to allow identification and access to
the hydrant.   [_ _]
6. Record the details of any further works required in the ""Work
Done""area of the Job Sheet.
7. Raise a new  job sheet for any corrective action that is required.

   Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
   and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to
   leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths,
   lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting,
   Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon

A  INTRODUCTION
   This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
   electrical installations of Technical Shelters 8 and 9 as
   well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the
   relevant areas.
B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
   (Technical Shelters TSH 8 & 9)
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Technical shelters.
2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,
   use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
   abnormal events.  [_ _]
3. Check the interior lighting for operation, including the
   operational tube within EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or
   repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
4. For TSH 09 only, go to Step 8.
5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
   accessible equipment and components within distribution
   panels.  Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures
   of ambient plus 10C should be considered abnormal and must
   be noted in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and
   ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
   the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
   action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
   terminals, equipment and components  for evidence of burn
   marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything
   abnormal in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and raise
   a new jobsheet for any corrective action. Ensure the Team
   Leader or his representative is informed of the
   abnormality.  [_ _]
7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
   contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,
   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general
   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required
   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
   actions.  [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
10.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
   dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
   accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
   Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
12.Inspect systems, mounted within the Technical Shelters, for
   faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
   buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp replacement
   or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
13.Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for
   operation and security.  Check with the Traffic Control Room
   Operator to confirm the receipt of an alarm.  Repair faulty
   of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding defects
   in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
14.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
   or his representative of any corrective actions.  Include in
   the Related Job field of the new and this job, the job
   number of the alternate job. [_ _]
C  TSH 8 & 9 Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform
   the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and
   or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,
   ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.
   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops
   of cabinets, tops of cabinet doors,  tops of meter
   escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
   cleaning materials .  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
   fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris. [_ _]
7. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait. replace bait
   station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
8. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
   job sheet.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
   corrective actions.  [_ _]
10. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
    (a) All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
    (b) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
    (c) In TSH 09, ensure UPS is left in a state of readiness
        for operation. [_ _]
11.  Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
     Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
     or his representative of any corrective actions.
     Include in the Related Job field of the new and this job,
     the number of the alternate Job.[_ _]
12. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.

3. ,,Follow the steps below to check the Automatic operation ,,of ,,the
Barrier
,,-Open the Emeregency Services Boom gate control box.[_ _]
,,-Check the Automatic (Green)  Indicator Lamp is ON.[_ _]
,,-Make sure that there is no traffic passing prior to ,,operation.[_ _]
,,-Contact the Control Room & ask the operator to lower the ,,
barrier.[_ _]
,,-When the barrier lowers, observe whether the Barrier Raise ,,
Indicator Lamp Turn Off & Barrier Lower Indicator Lamp Turn ,,
ON.[_ _]
,,-Similarly when the Barrier has returned to the raised,,position
Barrier Raise Indicator Lamp Turns ON and Lower ,,Indicator Lamp Turn
OFF.[_ _]
,,-When the Barrier operates check the RED warning lights for ,,correct
,,Operation.[_ _]
,,-Ask the control room operator to perform one more cycle & ,,

   standard sets out the procedure to be adopted when testing
   and proving the operation of battery backed emergency
   lighting.

   this discharge test.   [_ _]

   tubes have been replaced.

   EX2 - 2 x 10w tube
   EX3 - 2 x 10w tube
   EX4 - 2 x 10w tube
   EX5 - 2 x 10W tube
   EXB1 - 1 x 10w tube.

   90 minutes. Monitor the lights and record on   EMERGENCY
   LIGHTING DISCHARGE TEST - SUBSTATION 3 AND ENVIRONS
   TMF-3012-OP-0245, only those lights which does not provide
   suitable area lighting for the required 90 minutes.

   indicator functions correctly.  Record on EMERGENCY LIGHTING
   DISCHARGE TEST -  SUBSTATION 3 AND ENVIRONS TMF-3012-OP-0245,

   indicator does not function correctly.

   parameters in the Work Done area of the  of the job sheet.
10. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne City
   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
3. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
3.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
     vibration.   [_ _]
3.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
     a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
        LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
        measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
        temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
        setting.   [_ _]
     b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
        the following steps
        (i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
            displayed)
       (ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
      (iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
            setting.
       (iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
        (v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
       (vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that
            temperature shown on unit  is consistent with new
            setpoint and verify temperature is consistent with
            ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
            thermometer.   [_ _]
     c. Repeat above steps to restore the setpoint to the
        original setting.   [_ _]
     d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
        point is reached and verify that the temperature is
        consistent with ambient using the portable
        thermometer.   [_ _]
   NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
   cycle.
3.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
     and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
3.4. Check filters and replace if necessary.   Filter type
     Liebert size 650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
3.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm drain line
     clear.   [_ _]
3.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
4. ACC Condenser Unit
4.1. Inspect the condensor unit and check for undue cycling
     operation.   [_ _]
4.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
     running.   [_ _]
4.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local isolating
     switch.   [_ _]
4.4. Inspect for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
4.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
4.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
4.7. Switch the fan ON at the fan isolator.   [_ _]
4.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
     Unit.   [_ _]

A  INTRODUCTION
This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
installations of Substations as well the cleaning, inspections
and maintenance of the relevant areas.

B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
(Substations 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 - General )
1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Substations
   areas.
2. A visual inspection of substations 1- 5 and substation 6
  (Ground type outdoor) is to be carried out with attention
   given to the following:
   (a) On entering switchrooms, temporarily switch OFF
       ventilation fans, if operating, toreduce ambient
       noise.   [_ _]
   (b) Inspect for water in any cable trenches.
   (c) Visually inspect for evidence of condensation in
       buildings.  [_ _]
   (d) Visually inspect equipment enclosures and metal
       structures and fixtures for evidence of corrosion or
       other environmental conditions.  [_ _]
   (e) Any unusual smell which may indicate overheating.  [_ _]
   (f) Listen for any noise which may indicate an electrical
       discharge or looseness of components.  [_ _]
   (g) Visually inspect the main earthing busbars and
       connections for degradation and damage.  [_ _]
   (h) Remove any rubbish, dust, debris, materials or equipment
       that serves no purpose within or near substations.  [_ _]
   (i) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet,
       inspection results requiring further corrective actions.
       Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works and
       notify the Team Leader or his representative.  Include
       in the Related Job field of the new and this job, the
       job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
   (j) Prior to leaving the Substation ensure the ventilation
       fans are returned to service.  [_ _]
3. Inspect the doors and locking facilities of substations,
   enclosures within, outdoor enclosures, for operation, damage,
   leaks and or corrosion.  [_ _]
4. Ensure all danger notices and labels are in place and are
   maintained in a legible condition.  Any single line diagram
   (or similar) is easily readable.  [_ _]
   (Dry Type Transformers - Cast Resin 1A, 1B, 2A, 2B, 3A, 3B,
   4A, 4B, 5A & 5B )
5. (a) Visually inspect transformer enclosures for evidence of
       corrosion and or damage.   [_ _]
   (b) Check that the Winding temperature instrument is
       operational and that the alarm is connected to the PMCS
       and the Traffic Control Room.   [_ _]
   (c) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection
       results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a
       new job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the
       Team Leader or his representative.  Include in the
       Related Job field of the new and this job, the job number
       number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
(HV Protection Systems)
6. (a) Visually inspect that the battery supply is available for
       the incoming and distribution overcurrent and earth fault
       relay systems. e.g. all protection displays are
       operational.   [_ _]
   (b) Reset any relay operational targets on protection devices
       AS required.   [_ _]
   (c) Visually inspect the Capacitive voltage neon indicators
       for correct operation.   [_ _]
   (d) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection
       results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a
       new job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the
       Team Leader or his representative.  Include in the
       Related Job field of the new and this job, the job number
       number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]
(High Voltage SM6 Schneider Switchgear)
7. (a) Visually inspect the enclosures and control panels for
       evidence of damage and or corrosion.   [_ _]
   (b) Inspect the outside of the switchboard and remove
       accumulated dust and dirt and clean.   [_ _]
   (c) Visually check all auxiliary wiring, plugs and
       terminations in low voltage instrument compartment. [_ _]
   (d) Visually inspect that the battery supply is available for
       the incoming and distribution overcurrent and earth fault
       relay systems. e.g. all protection displays are

   (e) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection

       Related Job field of the new and this job, the job number

1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
2. Check with the control room if any UPS alarms are relevant.
3. Refer to MGE UPS Systems Manual, Galaxy User Manual
   E-679380XT/FA, M-STG-EL-24009, and Schnieder Electric Tunnel
   Electrical Services Training Notes, M-STG-EL-24001,
   Section 9.
    WARNING
   THE UPS BATTERY POTENTIAL IS APPROXIMATELY 380 VOLTS AND IS
   EARTHED.  THE BATTERIES CAN DELIVER A FAULT CURRENT OF
   APPROXIMATELY 9000 AMPS.  EXPOSED BATTERY TERMINALS ARE
   DANGEROUS AND MUST NOT BE TOUCHED.  IN THE VICINITY OF THE
   BATTERIES USE ONLY TOOLS WHICH ARE FULLY INSULATED.
   SAFETY GLASSES MUST BE WORN WHEN CARRYING OUT  MEASUREMENTS
   ON THE BATTERIES.
4. Check the UPS control panel readout for alarms and or normal
   status.  If an alarm is found, record the alarm in the Work
   Done Area of the Job Sheet. Do Not Continue with this Job if
   an alarm is present.  [_ _]
5. Record measurements on form 03 M MGE Uninterruptible Power
   Supply Battery Inspection and Test, TMF-3012-OP-0099.
6. Measure and record the UPS room temperature.   [_ _]
7. Check and record DC voltage and AC ripple voltage for each
   bank of batteries.  If a discrepancy is found then record in
   the Work Done Area of the Job Sheet.  Do Not Continue
   this job sheet if there is a discrepancy in the readings
   recorded and the readings expected.  [_ _]
8. To simulate a power failure, Open Mains 1 Isolator (Q1), the
   UPS operation will change to the batteries.  [_ _]
9. Operate the UPS, in this mode, for at least 10
   minutes.  [_ _]
10. Measure and record the DC voltage for each shelf of the
    battery banks.
11. Measure and record the DC current flow in each battery bank.
12. Return the UPS to normal operation by closing Mains 1
    Isolator Q1.  [_ _]
13. With an Optical thermometer measure the temperature of the
    batteries and their inter-connections.  Temperature readings
    should approximate ambient room temperature.  When a
    connection is found to having a temperature greater than 5
    degrees above room  temperature, in the Work Done Area of
    the Job Sheet, record the battery location, terminal
    identification, measured  temperature.  [_ _]
14. With an Optical thermometer measure the average temperature
    of the two (AC & DC) capacitor banks and record the result.
15. With an anemometer measure and record the airflow from each
    of the UPS cooling fans.
16. With the Optical thermometer measure and record the
    temperature of each of the UPS cooling fans.  [_ _]
17. Ensure Normal operation of the UPS.  [_ _]
18. Sweep and clean the UPS room:
    Sweep the floor and remove accumulated webs from the
    walls.   [___]
    Sweep the control panel room floors as well, vacuum the
    control panel enclosures and any surfaces that will collect
    dust deposits.   [___]
    Clean the front panel of all accumulated dirt and
    dust.   [___]
    Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
19. On completion of job record anything outside normal
    parameters
    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
         leaks
         lighting faults
         door damage
         evidence of structural damage to the UPS room and
         equipment etc,  in the "Work Done"section of the job
         sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
         representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
20. Leave a duplicate 03M MGE Uninterruptible Power Supply
    Battery Inspection and  test form in the UPS room.  Compare
    previously recorded data and record in the Work Done
    Area of the Job Sheet any data that shows any degradation.

****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****

ASSET CONDITION RATING

Rate the Condition of the Asset.

Note:

[ 1 ] - Excellent.
        Asset is new or in as new condition

[ 2 ] - Good.
        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing
        it's intended function.

[ 3 ] - Fair.
        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
        deterioration that will result is some intervention
        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
        performing it's intended function to the full degree.

ON position to operate

          to confirm it varies to maintain a positive pressure
differential  (
>50Pa).  [_ _]

          to the MANUAL position and the ON/OFF selector switch to the
OFF position.  Isolate the

     (f) Remove the access panels and clean the interior of the unit of
accumulated dirt and
           debris.  [_ _]
     (g ) Clean the motor exterior of accumulated dust and debris.  [_
_]
     (h) Check the fan unit for damage, corrosion, lost or missing
fixings etc.  repair if
            required.   [_ _]

 to the AUTO

 Apply the grease while the
             fan is rotating, continue until all the old grease is
purged from the grease
              relief port. [_ _]

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Unit
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     vibration.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        temperature should be within 2 degrees of the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        thermostat setting.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        the following steps
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        (i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	            displayed)
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       (ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	      (iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	            setting.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       (iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        (v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       (vi) Wait until unit cuts out,  and verify that
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	            temperature shown on unit  is consistent with
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	            new setpoint and verify temperature is consistent
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	            with ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	            thermometer.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        original setting.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        point is reached and verify that the temperature is
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        consistent with ambient using the portable
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        thermometer.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       cycle.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     (a) RRB Room and ERE 01 - Filter type Liebert size
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	         650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     (b) ERE 00 - Filter type Liebert size 500 x 450 x
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	         50mm.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm drain line is
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     clear.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.6. Restart unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     operation.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     running.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.3. Switch the fan OFFusing the local isolating switch.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.7. Switch the fan ON at the fan isolating switch.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     Unit.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    thoroughfares:

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
