            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       pressure cut out switches. [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (e) Confirm that the refrigerant charge is correct and that
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       there are no leaks.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (f) Check the crankcase heater for correct
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       operation.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (g) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       fit a new dryer if required.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (h) Check that the compressor mounting rubbers are secure and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       serviceable.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	9. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   service at the evaporator.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (a) Check the efficiency of the evaporator.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (b) Check the evaporator air flow.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (c) Check the evaporator fan operation for efficiency and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        rectify any degraded operation.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (d) Check the evaporator for leaks, repair any faults
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        found.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (e) Check the filter media for efficiency and operation, fit
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        a new filter if required.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	10. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    service at the condenser.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (a) Check the condenser air flow.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (b) Check the cooling fan(s) operation for efficiency and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        rectifying any degraded operation.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (c) Check the condenser for leaks, repair any faults
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        found.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	11. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    service at the humidifier (where fitted).
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (a) Check the humidifier inlet water strainer for
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       blockage.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (b) Check the humidifier operation.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	12. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	14. If sub contractor costs are unknown use the amount entered
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    in the Estimated Job Costs as an additional cost in the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    transactions.  Use Sub-contractor Costs - Outside Services.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	ASSET CONDITION RATING
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	Note:
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        Asset is new or in as new condition
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	[ 2 ] - Good.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        it's intended function.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	[ 3 ] - Fair.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	[ 4 ] - Poor.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        intended function.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
000030014516	03 M Elect Insp / Cln RRB rooms         	0000000000015520	03 M Elect Insp / Cln RRB rooms         	A	AU02138 	01	03 M Electrical Inspection / Clean RRBroadcast rooms
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Lubricant Spray, Rodent bait station,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	A  INTRODUCTION
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   electrical installations of Radio Rebroadcast Rooms 01, 02 &
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   03 as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   relevant areas.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   ( RRB 01, 02 & 03)
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Radio Rebroadcast
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   rooms.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   abnormal events.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	3. Check the interior lighting for operation, including the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   operational tube within EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4. For RRB 01 only, go to Step 8.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   accessible equipment and components within distribution
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   panels.  Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   of ambient plus 10C should be considered abnormal and must
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   be noted in the Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
   ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
   the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
   action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
   terminals, equipment and components  for evidence of burn
   marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything
   abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and raise
   a new jobsheet for any corrective action.  Ensure the Team
   Leader or his representative is informed of the
   abnormality. [_ _]
7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
   contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,
   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general
   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required
   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
   actions. [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
10.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
   dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
   accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
   Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
12.Inspect systems, mounted within the Technical Shelters, for
   faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
   buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp replacement
   or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
13.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
   or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
C  RRB room 01, 02 & 03  Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
   details in the "Work Done" area of the job sheet and inform
   the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and
   or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,
   ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on
   all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops of
   cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
   cleaning materials .  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
   fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris. [_ _]
7. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait, replace bait
   station if bait is nearly exhausted.  [_ _]
8. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
   job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
   corrective actions.  [_ _]
10.Prior to leaving the site ensure:
    (a)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
    (b)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
11.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
   or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
12. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.







000030014517	03 M Insp of A/C units SS 02.           	0000000000015521	03 M Insp of A/C units SS 02.           	A	AU01743 	01	03 M Inspect of Liebert A/C units at Substation 2.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	2. Access to the Air Conditioning units in the Substation 2
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   building is via external doors into the SS02 building in Swan
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Street. The condenser units are located on the roof of the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   building.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     vibration.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        setting.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        the following steps
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       (i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	           displayed)
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	      (ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     (iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	           setting.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	      (iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       (v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	      (vi) Wait until unit cuts out,  and verify that
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	           temperature shown on unit is consistent with new
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	           setpoint and verify temperature is consistent with
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	           ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	           thermometer.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        original setting.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        point is reached and verify that the temperature is
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        consistent with ambient using the portable
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        thermometer.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	  NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	  cycle.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary.   Filter type
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     Liebert size 650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     is clear.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.1.  Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	      operation.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     running.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local fan isolating
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	      switch.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.6. Clean the condenser coils, if required using compressed
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     air.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local fan isolator.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	     Unit.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    thoroughfares:
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    walls.   [___]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    will collect dust deposits.   [___]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    enclosure.  [___]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    dust.   [___]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    Clear any blockages.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	7.0. On completion of job record anything outside normal
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    parameters
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	         leaks
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	         lighting faults
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	         door damage
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    evidence of structural damage to the Equipment room and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    equipment etc,  in the Work Done section of the job sheet
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    and report to the Team Leader or his representative and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    raise a new job for any repairs.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
000030014518	12 M Insp TSH 09 Liebert A/C units      	0000000000015522	12 M Insp TSH 09 Liebert A/C units      	A	AU01821 	01	12 M Inspect TSH 09 Liebert A/C units
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   out by the sub-contractor in the presence of the electrical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   electronic technician and in conjunction with the 3 monthly
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   service.

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	3. Access to the TSH 09 Air Conditioning units in the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Substation 2 building is via external doors into the SS02
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   building in Swan Street.  The condenser units are located on
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   the roof of the  building.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5. Check the electrical switchboard for
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (a) Faulty indicating lamps  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (b) Connections, contacts, wiring and or components that may
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       be overheating.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	6. Compare the meter readings of the motor current with the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   nameplate ratings.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	7. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following electrical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   service:
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (a) Check switchboard for overload settings.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (b) Check all electrical control equipment operations and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       calibration.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (c) Check functionality and calibration of microprocessor
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       based controls.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	8. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   service at the compressor.

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       superheat.   [_ _]

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       pressures.  [_ _]

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (g) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       fit new new dryer if required.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (h) Check that the compressor mounting rubbers are secure and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	       serviceable.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	9. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   service at the evaporator.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (a) Check the efficiency of the evaporator.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (b) Check the evaporator air flow.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   (c) Check the evaporator fan operation for efficiency and

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	10. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    service at the condenser.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (a) Check the condenser air flow.   [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	    (b) Check the cooling fan(s) operation for efficiency and
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	        rectifying any degraded operation.   [_ _]

            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   Lubricant Spray, Rodent bait station,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	A  INTRODUCTION
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   electrical installations of Radio Rebroadcast Rooms 01, 02 &
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   03 as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   relevant areas.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   ( RRB 01, 02 & 03)
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Radio Rebroadcast
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   rooms.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   abnormal events.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	3. Check the interior lighting for operation, including the
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   operational tube within EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	4. For RRB 01 only, go to Step 8.
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   accessible equipment and components within distribution
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   panels.  Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   of ambient plus 10C should be considered abnormal and must
            	                                        	                	                                        	 	        	  	   be noted in the Work Done" area of the Job Sheet and
   ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
   the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
   action [_ _]
6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,
   terminals, equipment and components  for evidence of burn
   marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything
   abnormal in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and raise
   a new jobsheet for any corrective action.  Ensure the Team
   Leader or his representative is informed of the
   abnormality. [_ _]
7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and
   contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]
8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,
   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general
   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required
   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
   actions. [_ _]
9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,
   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]
10.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
   dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any
   accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]
11.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
   Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
12.Inspect systems, mounted within the Technical Shelters, for
   faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and
   buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp replacement
   or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
13.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
   or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
C  RRB room 01, 02 & 03  Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance
1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
   details in the "Work Done" area of the job sheet and inform
   the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and
   or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,
   ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on
   all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops of
   cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
   cleaning materials .  [_ _]
5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light
   fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]
6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris. [_ _]
7. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait, replace bait
   station if bait is nearly exhausted.  [_ _]
8. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
   job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
   corrective actions.  [_ _]
10.Prior to leaving the site ensure:
    (a)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
    (b)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
11.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
   or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
12. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.

1. The 12 month service of the air conditioner shall be carried
   out by the sub-contractor in the presence of the electrical
   electronic technician and in conjunction with the 3 monthly
   service.
2. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
3. Access to ERW02 is via the stairwell in Alexandra Avenue. The
   equipment  room is adjacent to Substation 4.
  NOTE: Parking restrictions may apply between 7.00am and
  5.30pm.
  The airconditioning unit is located in equipment room ERW02
  and the condenser unit is located in the riser, adjacent to
  Substation 4.  Access for detailed inspection of the condenser
  unit is restricted.
4. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and
   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
5. Check the electrical switchboard for
   (a) faulty indicating lamps   [_ _]
   (b) connections, contacts, wiring and or components that may
       be overheated.   [_ _]
6. Compare the meter readings of the motor current with the
   nameplate ratings.   [_ _]
7. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following electrical
   service:
   (a) Check switchboard for overload settings.   [_ _]
   (b) Check all electrical control equipment operations and
       calibration.   [_ _]
   (c) Check functionality and calibration of microprocessor
       based controls.   [_ _]
8. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
   service at the compressor.
   (a) Accurately assess and record compressor
       superheat.   [_ _]
   (b) Check and record the suction and discharge
       pressures.   [_ _]
   (c) Check that the suction and discharge pressures are normal
       and stable.   [_ _]
   (d) Check the setting and operation of the high and low
       pressure cut out switches. [_ _]
   (e) Confirm that the refrigerant charge is correct and that
       there are no leaks.   [_ _]
   (f) Check the crankcase heater for correct operation.   [_ _]
   (g) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),
       fit a new dryer if required.   [_ _]
   (h) Check that the compressor mounting rubbers are secure and
       serviceable.   [_ _]
9. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
   service at the evaporator.
   (a) Check the efficiency of the evaporator.   [_ _]
   (b) Check the evaporator air flow.   [_ _]
   (c) Check the evaporator fan operation for efficiency and
       rectify any degraded operation.   [_ _]
   (d) Check the evaporator for leaks, repair any faults
       found.   [_ _]
   (e) Check the filter media for efficiency and operation, fit
       a new filter if required.   [_ _]
10. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
    service at the condenser.
    (a) Check the condenser air flow.   [_ _]
    (b) Check the cooling fan(s) operation for efficiency and
        rectifying any degraded operation.   [_ _]
    (c) Check the condenser for leaks, repair any faults
        found.   [_ _]
11. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
    service at the humidifier (where fitted).
    (a) Check the humidifier inlet water strainer for
        blockage.   [_ _]
    (b) Check the humidifier operation.   [_ _]
12. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal
    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
14. If sub contractor costs are unknown use the amount entered
    in the Estimated Job Costs as an additional cost in the
    transactions.  Use Sub-contractor Costs - Outside Services.

1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this job.
2. Reference: Melbourne City Link - The Beam Periodic
   Non-Destructive Testing - Scope.
   Report No. 4199/004 (rev01) Provided by Intico.
3. The NDT ACFM testing is to be carried out by the
   sub-contractor in the presence of the Civil Worker.
Item 3
(a) From within the beam on the southern side, perform  NDT ACFM
    inspection of the skin plates, in the area of the base plate
    to skin welds.  The area of the inspection is to cover
     from frame CF2 to the Eastern end of the beam
(b) From within the beam on the northern side, perform  NDT ACFM
    inspection of the skin plates, in the area of the base plate
    to skin  welds.  The area of the inspection is to cover from
    frame CF2 to the Eastern end of the beam
(c) On the extrernal surface of the southern side of beam,
    perform NDT ACFM inspection of the skin plates, in the area
    of the base plate to skin welds.  The area of the inspection
    is to cover from frame CF2 to the Eastern end of the beam.
(d) On the extrernal surface of the northern side of beam,
    perform NDT ACFM inspection of the skin plates, in the area
    of the base plate to skin welds.  The area of the inspection
    is to cover from frame CF2 to the Eastern end of the beam.
(e) Record the results of each test.
Item 5
(a) From within the beam on the southern side, perform  NDT ACFM
    inspection of the skin plates to frame CF3 welds.  The area
    of the inspection is to cover from frame CF3 for approx 1.5m
    in either direction
(b) From within the beam on the southern side, perform  NDT ACFM
    inspection of the base plate weld area.  The area of the
    inspection is to cover from frame CF3 for approx 1.5m in
    either direction
(c) On the external surface of the northern side of beam,
    perform  NDT ACFM inspection of the skin plates to frame CF3
    welds.  The area of the inspection is to cover from frame
    CF3 for approx 1.5m in either direction
(d) On the external surface of the northern side of the beam,
    perform  NDT ACFM inspection of the base plate weld area.
    The area of the inspection is to cover from frame CF3 for
    approx 1.5m in either direction
(e) Record the results of each test.
Item 7
(a) From within the beam, on the southern side, perform NDT ACFM
    inspection on frame CF2 welds.  The welds are the top corner
    weld, the bottom corner weld and the brace to frame welds.
(b) From within the beam, on the northern side, perform NDT ACFM
    inspection on frame CF2 welds.  The welds are the top corner
    weld, the bottom corner weld and the brace to frame welds.
(c) Record the results of each test.
Item 9
(a) From within the beam, on the southern side, perform NDT ACFM
    inspection on frame CF3 welds.  The welds are the top corner
    weld, the bottom corner weld and the brace to frame welds.
(b) From within the beam, on the northern side, perform NDT ACFM
    inspection on frame CF3 welds.  The welds are the top corner
    weld, the bottom corner weld and the brace to frame welds.
(c) Record the results of each test.
Item 13
(a) From within the beam, on the southern side, perform NDT ACFM
    inspection on frame CF3 welds.  The welds are the bottom
    corner weld, the web plate to frame welds (2 web plates of
    the frame vertical column) and three web plates (welds of
    frame CF3 lower horizontal C channel).
(b) From within the beam, on the northern side, perform NDT ACFM
    inspection on frame CF3 welds.  The welds are the bottom
    corner weld, the web plate to frame welds (2 web plates of
    the frame vertical column) and three web plates (welds of
    frame CF3 lower horizontal C channel).
(c) Record the results of each test.
4. Provide a report setting out the results of all tests as well
    a list setting out any outstanding works that was found as
    result of the tests.
5. Notify the Traffic Control room on completion of the job.

1. Keys to perimeter access gates are required.
2. Inspect the pollution control ponds and record the results on the
form Sediment Ponds Inspection  TMF-3012-OP-0035:
   (a) Remove rubbish and debris from the pond and spillway.
   (b) Inspect the pond embankments for structural integrity
       and erosion.
   (c) Check pond for excessive weed infestation, odours,
       breeding insects and sediment accumulation.
   (d) Mow the banks of the pond and remove cuttings as
       necessary.
   (e) Remove excess silt (when silt build-up is higher than
       300 mm below the outlet level).  Do not remove the clay
       lining of the pond.
   (f) Inspect the spillway for blockages, remove any debris or
       materials causing a blockage.
   (g) Inspect the low flow outlets for blockages, remove any
       accumualted debris or materials capable of causing a
       blockage.

   parameters in the section of the Job Sheet below and raise
   a new job sheet for any repair works that are required.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

1. Notify control room prior to stopping in emergency lane.
2. Reference Manual; RTA, VMS Type B - 3 Line, Operation and
   Maintenance Manual, M-MCL-TM-100026.
3. Carry out visual inspection externally and internally of the
   cabinets, sign, external cables and conduits for vandalism,
   mechanical damage, water ingress, condensation or insect
   infestation. Also check inside cabinets for tripped circuit
   breakers, disconnected wires, burn marks from excessive heat.
   [_ _]
4. Visually check for loose or missing nuts and bolts, and for
   rusted areas, rusted nuts or bolts. Cleans with wire brush
   and spray with Cold Gal or equivalent. This should be done
   with care and to avoid overspray. [_ _]
5. Check and clean inlet and outlet mesh of heat exchange units.
   [_ _]
6. Check and clean cooling fans. [_ _]
7. Arrange with the TCR for a Test Message to be displayed on
   the VMS. Monitor operation and repair as required.  Monitor
   the LED Arrays and the Flashers for failed LEDS and record in
   the Work Done area of the Job Sheet if the failed LEDs exceed
   10% of the array.
8. Arrange a new Job sheet for any outstanding works, recording
   the appropriate Job numbers in the Related Jobs field and
   Notify the Team Leader or his representative   of any
   outstanding works.  [_ _]
9. Notify control room on departure.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
2. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
   Plans 21, 22, 23, 24, 25, 26.
   In the work done area record:
   a. Any deviations from the plan.
   b. Lane closure start time.
   c. Lane closure finish time.
   d. Weather conditions.
3. Joint Leakage Drains (JLD) are located on the outside of the
   left and right hand lanes of the tanked section of the
   Burnley Tunnel.
4. Inspect JLDrains for water flow, blockages, deposits and
   conditions.  Record the details for each drain between B20 to ,,B38
on form Burnley Tunnel Joint Leakage Drain ,,TMF-3012-OP-0275A.
5. The JLD's are inspected via an inspection point which is a
   square Gatic plate with a hinged lid. This lid is held secure
   in position by a Philips head screw.
6. Access both ends of drain by unscrewing covers in both the
   LHL and the RHL.
   (a) To inspect the drain sets, shine the torch down one open
       cover, then at the corresponding open cover, using the
       extendable mirror, look for the lighted torch.
   (b) Record the condition of the pipe e.g. the cleanliness
       and / or blockage of the drain on form Burnley Tunnel
       Joint Leakage Drain  TMF-3012-OP-0275A.
   (c) Record the condition of each drain e.g. buildup of
       calcite, slime, silt etc and whether or not there is a
       flow of water present.
     **Use Condition Words :  WET,  DRY,  CLEAR, OBSTRUCTED and
       if obstructed record the action that was taken to clear
       the obstruction ( ie:  hydrant flushed or Jet flushed).
7. If there is water flow present, then at the dirty water pit,
   inspect the Dirty Water pit where the flow enters (If it does
   enter into a pit).  Measure and record the flow and elapsed
   time for on form Burnley Tunnel Joint Leakage Drain
   TMF-3012-OP-0275A.
8. Record all details on the inspection sheet, as all the
   information is important.
9. Ensure all the pit covers and Gatic covers are closed and
   secured on completion of each inspection.
10. Ensure a completed copy of the form Burnley Tunnel Joint
    Leakage Drain TMF-3012-OP-0275A. are forwarded to  the Civil
    Team Leader or representative on completion of the job and
    prior to end of shift.  Civil Team Leader or representative
    is to record and sign off each form and raise any actions
   (job sheets) for further inspection or cleaning

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

1.  Collecting of dust sample should be performed in conjunction
    with mid year Burnley Tunnel Jet Fan maintenance activities,
    as this will ensure all necessary Traffic Management is in
    place.
2. Refer to procedure TMI-3012-OP-0042, Tunnel Dust Sampling.
3. The dust sample must be taken from the top of a Jet Fan that
   is located between Burnley Tunnel sections B50 and B54.
Note: There are four Jet Fans located in this section of the Burnley
Tunnel, these are JFE32 (Right Lane), JFE33 (Left Lane),
JFE34 (Right Lane), and JFE35 (Left Lane).
4. Take two samples from any one of the above Jet Fans.  The two
   samples are to be taken with the use of an uncontaminated
   disposable glove by sweeping up the dust by hand.
   An approximate amount of two tablespoons per sample is
   adequate for testing.  Place the dust samples into two
   separate clear zip bags (sealable bags).  Eye protection
   and a Class P2 Dust mask should be worn whilst taking the
   samples, as the dust particles may be disturbed and become
   airborne.
5. Label both test samples with the Jet Fan number, job number
   and date.
6. Forward both samples to the Maintenance Engineer, or
   Supervisor Elect or his representative who will arrange for
   testing to be carried out by AWN Consultants
   (ph: 03 9758 7299).

The measure of water flowing from the Swan Street pump station
is a measure of all the water collected in the Burnley Tunnel
drainage systems, from both dirty and Groundwater sources.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**

1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL
   DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0031.
3. The Civil Team leader is to provide a copy of the previous
   WEEKLY BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0233 for
   detail of the previous readings.
4. At the Swan Street Pump Station Motor Control Centre, record
   the Time and the Total flow in kilo litres for the pump
   station on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
   TMF-3012-OP-0233.
5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
6. Ensure a copy of the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
   TMF-3012-OP-0233 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
   evaluation on completion  of the job.
   Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
   in excess of  0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
   job to investigate to check the various bay flows for the
   reason to the change in water flowrate.

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
